original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba na /🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba na / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing /
translated: When they are training on the path to awakening,🔽they are purifying a buddhafield and bringing beings to maturity,

original: sems can rnams yengs su smin par byed kyang gang dmigs nas gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gang yang mi dmigs so ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams yengs su smin par byed kyang gang dmigs nas gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gang yang mi dmigs so //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: but they do not apprehend any being to be trained.

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti addressed the Blessed One as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang la spyad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang la spyad de /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽what is the bodhisattva great beings’ path,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gang lags /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gang lags /
translated: through which they bring beings to maturity and purify a buddhafield?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings, from the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: practice the transcendent perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @181a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @181a *//
translated: the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, the transcendent perfection of tolerance,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: the transcendent perfection of perseverance, the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, and the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyod par byed cing /
translated: and they practice the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: they bring sentient beings to full maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: and they refine the buddhafields.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving bring beings to maturity?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom give gifts to beings.

original: sbyin pa byin nas kyang 'di ltar 'doms shing rjes su ston te /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin nas kyang 'di ltar 'doms shing rjes su ston te /
translated: Having given gifts, they instruct and teach them like this:

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: ‘Children of good family,

original: 'di la sbyin pa la sbyin par 'dzin pas 'dzin par ma byed cig /
analyzed: 'di la sbyin pa la sbyin par 'dzin pas 'dzin par ma byed cig /
translated: don’t hold on to “giving” by holding on to “giving.”

original: sbyin pa la sbyin par 'dzin pas lus gang mngon par grub pas sdug bsngal mang po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i lus dag mngon par 'grub par ma byed cig /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sbyin par 'dzin pas lus gang mngon par grub pas sdug bsngal mang po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i lus dag mngon par 'grub par ma byed cig /
translated: Don’t create bodies that are created by holding on to “giving” and by holding on to “giving” that you will experience a lot of suffering.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /🔽'di la don dam par na sbyin pa'ang med /🔽sbyin bdag kyang med /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag / 'di la don dam par na sbyin pa'ang med / sbyin bdag kyang med /
translated: Children of good family,🔽here ultimately there is no giving,🔽no giver,

original: len pa po'ang med de /
analyzed: len pa po'ang med de /
translated: and no receiver.

original: chos de gsum ni rang bzhin gyis stong pas na rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos ni len par mi byed la /
analyzed: chos de gsum ni rang bzhin gyis stong pas na rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos ni len par mi byed la /
translated: Since these three dharmas are empty of a basic nature, a dharma that is empty of a basic nature does not take up anything.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni gzung ba'ang med do zhes /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni gzung ba'ang med do zhes /
translated: In emptiness of a basic nature there is no apprehended object.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub @181b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub @181b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving

original: de ltar sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed kyang de la sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de ltar sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed kyang de la sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: give gifts to sentient beings like that, but they do not apprehend a gift,

original: sbyin bdag kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin bdag kyang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a giver,

original: len pa po'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: len pa po'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: and they do not apprehend a recipient.

original: de ni mi dmigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni mi dmigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That is the perfection of nonapprehension,

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and it is like that perfection of giving.

original: de chos gsum po de dag thams cad mi dmigs pas sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sbyor bar byed do //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de chos gsum po de dag thams cad mi dmigs pas sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sbyor bar byed do //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: By not apprehending those three dharmas, they connect sentient beings with the result of stream enterer.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: and they connect them to the fruit of entering the stream, up to they connect them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /🔽de bdag kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing sbyin pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de / de bdag kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing sbyin pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving bring beings to maturity.🔽They themselves give gifts, and they cause others to take up giving, and they speak in praise of giving,

original: gzhan gang dag sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
translated: and they speak in praise of others giving gifts as well, welcoming it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa de lta bu byin nas /🔽rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa de lta bu byin nas / rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings, having given such gifts,🔽are reborn with the good fortune of a great sāla tree–like kṣatriya family,

original: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
translated: are reborn with the good fortune of a great sāla tree–like brahmin family,

original: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //🔽khams kyi rgyal por 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o // khams kyi rgyal por 'gyur ba'am /
translated: householders,🔽or as a king of a region,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
translated: or as a universal monarch.

original: 'khor @182a *// los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid thob nas kyang des sems can rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sdud par byed de /
analyzed: 'khor @182a *// los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid thob nas kyang des sems can rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sdud par byed de /
translated: Having obtained the kingdom of a universal monarch, they gather beings with the four means of gathering.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa dag gis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa dag gis sdud par byed do //
translated: What are the four?🔽They gather beings with generosity, kind talk, meaningful actions, and practicing what one preaches.

original: des sems can de dag sbyin pas bsdus nas rim gyis tshul khrims la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: des sems can de dag sbyin pas bsdus nas rim gyis tshul khrims la 'god par byed do //
translated: Having gathered beings with generosity, they gradually establish them in morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag dang /
translated: They establish them in the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways, the emptiness gateway, the signless gateway, the undirected gateway, the four perfect abandonments, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the four truths of the noble ones, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the four applications of mindfulness, up to the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed do //
translated: They establish them in the meditative stabilities of emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.

original: yang dag pa nyid kyi skyon med pa la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyi skyon med pa la 'jug par byed do //
translated: They introduce them to the maturity of the correct understanding of the nature of reality.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyi bar dag dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyi bar dag dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: They introduce them to the state of a worthy one, up to individual enlightenment, and to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: kye skyes bu dag //
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag //
translated: “O beings!

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi dka' ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi dka' ste /
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is not difficult to attain.

original: phyin ci log gis rmongs pa'i sems kyis ma rtogs pa ma gtogs par gang la sems can rnams chags pa'i chos gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyin ci log gis rmongs pa'i sems kyis ma rtogs pa ma gtogs par gang la sems can rnams chags pa'i chos gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Except for not understanding due to a deluded mind that is mistaken, there is no phenomenon whatsoever that exists by its own nature to which sentient beings are attached.

original: de'i phyir khyed cag gis phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa @182b thams cad spongs la /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed cag gis phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa @182b thams cad spongs la /
translated: Therefore, you should abandon all mistaken grasping.

original: bdag kyang 'khor ba las thar par gyis shig /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'khor ba las thar par gyis shig /
translated: Liberate yourselves from cyclic existence.

original: gzhan dag kyang thar bar gyis shig /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang thar bar gyis shig /
translated: Liberate others as well.

original: de ltar khyed cag gis bdag cag kyang don che bar gyis la /
analyzed: de ltar khyed cag gis bdag cag kyang don che bar gyis la /
translated: In that way, you should make yourselves meaningful.

original: gzhan dag kyang don chen po la sbyor bar gyis shig ces /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang don chen po la sbyor bar gyis shig ces /
translated: You should also connect others to what is meaningful.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, that is how bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of generosity.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i tshe sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i tshe sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: When they practice in that way, from the first production of the thought of awakening

original: gzhan yang ngan song du mi ltung ba dang / nam yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mi byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang ngan song du mi ltung ba dang / nam yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mi byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
translated: Moreover, he practices in such a way that he will not fall into the miserable destinies, and he will never fail to become a universal monarch.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sa bon ci 'dra ba 'bras bu'ang de 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon ci 'dra ba 'bras bu'ang de 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fruit is similar to the seed.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba de'i drung du slong mo pa gang dag lhags na /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba de'i drung du slong mo pa gang dag lhags na /
translated: When beggars come before the universal monarch,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: the universal monarch thinks this:

original: bdag gis 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid yongs su bzung ba ni sems can rnams kyi don ma gtogs par gzhan gyi phyir ma yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag gis 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid yongs su bzung ba ni sems can rnams kyi don ma gtogs par gzhan gyi phyir ma yin no snyam nas /
translated: “I have taken up the sovereignty of a universal monarch for the sake of sentient beings, and not for any other reason.”

original: de 'di skad du gang ci 'dod pa de dag khyed cag la byin zin gyi /
analyzed: de 'di skad du gang ci 'dod pa de dag khyed cag la byin zin gyi /
translated: He says this: “Whatever you desire, I have given it to you.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni khyed kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni khyed kyi yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this is yours.

original: nga'i ma yin no //
analyzed: nga'i ma yin no //
translated: It is not mine.

original: nga ni nang gi gzugs 'di'ang don du gnyer ba ma yin na gzhan dag lta ci smos te /
analyzed: nga ni nang gi gzugs 'di'ang don du gnyer ba ma yin na gzhan dag lta ci smos te /
translated: I do not even seek this inner form, much less anything else.”

original: ngas sems can thams cad kyi don du 'khor ba yongs su bzung ba ma gtogs par /
analyzed: ngas sems can thams cad kyi don du 'khor ba yongs su bzung ba ma gtogs par /
translated: I have taken up samsara for the sake of all sentient beings,

original: nga ni 'khor ba don du gnyer ba ma yin no zhes zer te /🔽de snying rje bas snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: nga ni 'khor ba don du gnyer ba ma yin no zhes zer te / de snying rje bas snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: but I do not pursue samsara.”🔽Through compassion, he perfects great compassion,

original: ji tsam du snying rje chen po @183a *//
analyzed: ji tsam du snying rje chen po @183a *//
translated: and through great compassion, he perfects the perfection of patience.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang ming dang / btags pa dang / brdas tha snyad 'dogs pa ma gtogs par gang dag yongs su grub par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems can dag mi dmigs te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang ming dang / btags pa dang / brdas tha snyad 'dogs pa ma gtogs par gang dag yongs su grub par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems can dag mi dmigs te /
translated: To the extent that he perfects great compassion and works for the welfare of sentient beings, he does not apprehend any sentient beings who are established in the way that they are designated, labeled, and verbally constructed.

original: tha snyad de'ang brag ca lta bur tha snyad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha snyad de'ang brag ca lta bur tha snyad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: And he should know that those verbal designations are like an echo, which is not a verbal designation.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar spyad pas sems can rnams la rdzas yongs su gtong bar mi 'gyur ba ci'ang med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar spyad pas sems can rnams la rdzas yongs su gtong bar mi 'gyur ba ci'ang med de /
translated: Subhūti, there is nothing that a bodhisattva great being does not give to sentient beings when practicing in such a way.

original: cher na bdag gi sha dag kyang yongs su gtong bar byed na /
analyzed: cher na bdag gi sha dag kyang yongs su gtong bar byed na /
translated: If I give away even my own flesh,

original: yo byad gang dag gis sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar par bya ba'i phyi rol gyi yo byad dag lta smos kyang ci dgos pa de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad gang dag gis sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar par bya ba'i phyi rol gyi yo byad dag lta smos kyang ci dgos pa de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: what need is there to mention external goods that I will give away in order to liberate sentient beings from cyclic existence?

original: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: yo byad de dag gang lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yo byad de dag gang lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: what are those goods?”

original: rab 'byor / yo byad de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yo byad de dag gang zhe na /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, what are those goods?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
translated: The perfection of generosity is a good.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
translated: The perfection of moral discipline is a good.🔽The perfection of patience is a good.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
translated: The perfection of perseverance is a good.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
translated: The perfection of concentration is a good.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is a good.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ni yo byad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ni yo byad do //
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are the equipment.

original: de dag ni yo byad yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni yo byad yin te /
translated: They are the equipment.

original: yo byad de dag gis phan btags pa'i sems @183b can rnams ni 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yo byad de dag gis phan btags pa'i sems @183b can rnams ni 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those sentient beings who are helped by that equipment will be liberated from cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de'i tshe /🔽tshig 'di skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de'i tshe / tshig 'di skad ces brjod de /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of giving, give gifts to sentient beings, at that time they say these words:

original: rigs kyi bu dag tshur shog /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag tshur shog /
translated: ‘Come here, sons of a good family!

original: ngas khyed cag zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag gis brel ba med par byas /
analyzed: ngas khyed cag zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag gis brel ba med par byas /
translated: I will not let you be in want of any necessities, from food and drink up to and including the seven precious stones.

original: khyed cag tshul khrims srungs shig /
analyzed: khyed cag tshul khrims srungs shig /
translated: You must guard morality.

original: khyed cag zas sam skom mam /
analyzed: khyed cag zas sam skom mam /
translated: You must guard morality, whether you are hungry or thirsty,

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi bar dag gam /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi bar dag gam /
translated: whether you are in want of the seven precious stones,

original: gang gis phongs nas tshul khrims 'chal par byed pa de dag ngas brel ba med par byas /
analyzed: gang gis phongs nas tshul khrims 'chal par byed pa de dag ngas brel ba med par byas /
translated: I will make sure that they are not poor and that they do not break the moral discipline.🔽You should all keep the moral discipline and abide by the three vehicles,

original: khyed cag ci nas kyang tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas nas theg pa gsum po nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: khyed cag ci nas kyang tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas nas theg pa gsum po nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: whether the vehicle of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi theg pa chen po gang yang rung bas rim gyis sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par gyis shig ces /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi theg pa chen po gang yang rung bas rim gyis sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par gyis shig ces /
translated: or the Great Vehicle, the vehicle of omniscience, and in due course reach the end of suffering.’

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of giving,

original: de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed do //
translated: in that way attract beings with the perfection of moral discipline.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of giving,

original: sems can gang dag 'khrug pa dang / gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'i sems can de dag la /
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'khrug pa dang / gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'i sems can de dag la /
translated: To those sentient beings who are in conflict, who have a mind of malice,

original: tshig 'di skad ces @184a *//
analyzed: tshig 'di skad ces @184a *//
translated: he says these words:

original: brjod de / rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: brjod de / rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of noble family,

original: khyed cag rgyu gang gis phongs nas 'khrug par byed pa'am /
analyzed: khyed cag rgyu gang gis phongs nas 'khrug par byed pa'am /
translated: what is the cause of your poverty that you are in conflict,🔽that you have malice,

original: gnod sems su byed pa'am /🔽skyon 'dogs par byed pa'i zas sam /
analyzed: gnod sems su byed pa'am / skyon 'dogs par byed pa'i zas sam /
translated: that you are finding fault?

original: skom mam / yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag nga las long zhig dang / ngas khyed cag phongs pa med par byas /
analyzed: skom mam / yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag nga las long zhig dang / ngas khyed cag phongs pa med par byas /
translated: Take from me whatever you need, whether it be food, drink, or any kind of goods, and I will make you free from poverty.

original: de'i phyir khyed cag 'khrug pa dang / gnod sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed cag 'khrug pa dang / gnod sems su ma byed cig /
translated: Therefore, do not be in conflict, do not have malice.

original: nga'ang khyed kyi yin la /
analyzed: nga'ang khyed kyi yin la /
translated: I am yours,

original: khyed kyang nga'i yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyang nga'i yin te /
translated: and you are mine.

original: nga la ci bdog pa de'ang khyed kyi yin gyi su la ci dgos pa dag long zhig dang / ngas khyed cag zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag gis phongs pa med par byas /
analyzed: nga la ci bdog pa de'ang khyed kyi yin gyi su la ci dgos pa dag long zhig dang / ngas khyed cag zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag gis phongs pa med par byas /
translated: Whatever I have belongs to you. Take whatever you need. I will make you free from poverty with food, drink, clothes, and any kind of goods.

original: ci nas kyang khyed cag khro ba dang / gnod sems kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar gyis shig /
analyzed: ci nas kyang khyed cag khro ba dang / gnod sems kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar gyis shig /
translated: “In every way, you should not fall under the power of anger and malice.”

original: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: ces de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: In this way, bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of generosity,

original: sems can de dag bzod pa la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: sems can de dag bzod pa la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: connect those beings with patience.

original: khyed cag gang gi phyir khro ba skye bar 'gyur ba de ni snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: khyed cag gang gi phyir khro ba skye bar 'gyur ba de ni snying po med pa ste /
translated: “Whatever it is that you are angry about is insubstantial.

original: de la ni dngos po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la ni dngos po gang yang med do //
translated: There is no real thing there at all.

original: khro ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su brtags pas khyed cag gang gi phyir mngon par chags pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / gnod sems su byed cing /
analyzed: khro ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su brtags pas khyed cag gang gi phyir mngon par chags pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / gnod sems su byed cing /
translated: That anger is a false imputation. For the sake of what you are attached to, agitated about, and malicious toward,

original: mngon par chags pa dang / 'khrugs pa dang / gnod sems su gyur nas kyang dbyig pas rdeg pa dang / mtshon gyis 'degs shing /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa dang / 'khrugs pa dang / gnod sems su gyur nas kyang dbyig pas rdeg pa dang / mtshon gyis 'degs shing /
translated: you become attached, agitated, and malicious, and then you beat each other with sticks and swords

original: gcig @184b gis gcig srog dang 'bral bar byed pa de la ni dngos po gang yang med do //
analyzed: gcig @184b gis gcig srog dang 'bral bar byed pa de la ni dngos po gang yang med do //
translated: and take each other’s lives. There is no real thing there at all.

original: de'i phyir khyed cag yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas 'khrugs par gyur na sems can dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed cag yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas 'khrugs par gyur na sems can dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, if you are disturbed by incorrect conceptualization, you will fall into the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
translated: or into the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
translated: or into the world of Yama,

original: de las gzhan pa'i ngan 'gro dag tu ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ngan 'gro dag tu ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: or into other lower realms.

original: der khyed cag sdug bsngal mi bzad pa /
analyzed: der khyed cag sdug bsngal mi bzad pa /
translated: There you will experience unbearable suffering,

original: rtsub pa / tsha ba dag gi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur gyi /🔽kye skyes bu dag las gang yongs su bzung bas mir skye ba'ang thob par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtsub pa / tsha ba dag gi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur gyi / kye skyes bu dag las gang yongs su bzung bas mir skye ba'ang thob par mi 'gyur na /
translated: harsh and painful sensations.🔽“O beings, do not grasp at the meaning of phenomena that do not exist, by grasping at which you will not even attain a human birth,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang phrad par 'gyur ba lta smos su'ang med pa de lta bu'i dngos po med pa'i chos rnams kyi don gyi las yongs su ma 'dzin cig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang phrad par 'gyur ba lta smos su'ang med pa de lta bu'i dngos po med pa'i chos rnams kyi don gyi las yongs su ma 'dzin cig /
translated: let alone encounter a buddha.

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: “O beings,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni rnyed par dka'o //
translated: it is difficult to find a buddha appearing.

original: mir skye ba'ang rnyed par dka' bas /
analyzed: mir skye ba'ang rnyed par dka' bas /
translated: It is difficult to find a human birth.

original: dal ba 'di chud gzan par ma byed cig /
analyzed: dal ba 'di chud gzan par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not waste this opportunity.

original: mi khom par gyur cing /
analyzed: mi khom par gyur cing /
translated: and will be incurable.’

original: gsor mi rung bar gyur ta re zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag kyang bzod pa sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: gsor mi rung bar gyur ta re zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag kyang bzod pa sgrub par byed la /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva great beings themselves practice patience,

original: gzhan dag kyang bzod pa la sbyor par byed cing bzod pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bzod pa la sbyor par byed cing bzod pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
translated: and they connect others to patience, and they praise patience,

original: gzhan gang dag bzod pa sgom pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag bzod pa sgom pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
translated: and they praise and rejoice in others who practice patience.

original: des sems can de dag bzod pa la sbyar cing bzod pa la bkod nas /
analyzed: des sems can de dag bzod pa la sbyar cing bzod pa la bkod nas /
translated: Having connected those beings to patience and established them in patience,

original: theg pa gsum gyis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed de /🔽rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems @185a *//
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed de / rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems @185a *//
translated: they gradually bring them to complete nirvāṇa by means of the three vehicles.

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: Subhūti, in that way the bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of giving,

original: sems can rnams bzod pa la sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams bzod pa la sbyor ba yin no //
translated: connect beings to patience.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of generosity connect beings to the perfection of perseverance?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can le lo can dag mthong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can le lo can dag mthong na /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings see lazy beings,

original: 'di skad du sems can khyed cag ci'i phyir le lo byed ces 'doms par byed do //
analyzed: 'di skad du sems can khyed cag ci'i phyir le lo byed ces 'doms par byed do //
translated: they advise them, ‘Beings, why are you lazy?’

original: de dag rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: de dag rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
translated: They say, ‘Because we do not have the conditions.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /🔽sems can de dag la 'di skad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa / sems can de dag la 'di skad du /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of generosity

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: advise those beings, ‘Hey, you!

original: ngas gang khyed cag la sbyin pa'i rkyen tam /
analyzed: ngas gang khyed cag la sbyin pa'i rkyen tam /
translated: I will give you the conditions for generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi rkyen tam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rkyen tam /
translated: the conditions for morality,

original: bzod pa'i rkyen tam /
analyzed: bzod pa'i rkyen tam /
translated: the conditions for patience,

original: rnam pa gzhan gang dag gis brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad nye bar bsgrub par byas /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gang dag gis brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad nye bar bsgrub par byas /
translated: They will provide them with all the conditions for the practice of diligence.

original: khyed cag brtson 'grus rtsoms shig ces zer te /
analyzed: khyed cag brtson 'grus rtsoms shig ces zer te /
translated: They will say, ‘You should practice diligence!’

original: der sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i yo byad de dag gis lus dang / sems kyi brtson 'grus rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: der sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i yo byad de dag gis lus dang / sems kyi brtson 'grus rtsom par byed de /
translated: And those beings, through the bodhisattva great beings’ provisions, will practice physical and mental diligence.

original: de dag lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de dag lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pas /
translated: Endowed with physical and mental diligence,

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: they will perfect all wholesome dharmas.

original: dge ba'i chos @185b de dag gis 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad sgom par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos @185b de dag gis 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad sgom par byed do //
translated: Through those wholesome dharmas they will cultivate all the noble dharmas free of defilements.

original: de dag bsgoms pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bsgoms pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating them they will attain the fruit of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, and the state of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain individual enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: In that way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving

original: sems can rnams brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba yin no //
translated: connect beings to the perfection of perseverance.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving

original: sems can rnam bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnam bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: connect beings to the perfection of concentration?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can sems rnam par g-yengs pa dag mthong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can sems rnam par g-yengs pa dag mthong na /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings see beings with distracted minds,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: they advise them like this:

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Hey, you men!

original: khyed cag ci'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la snyoms par mi 'jug ces 'doms par byed do //
analyzed: khyed cag ci'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la snyoms par mi 'jug ces 'doms par byed do //
translated: Why don’t you rest in meditation in the perfection of concentration?’

original: de dag 'di skad du rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
translated: If they say, ‘Because we do not have the conditions,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can de dag la 'di skad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can de dag la 'di skad du /
translated: then the bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of generosity should say to those sentient beings,

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Hey, you!

original: ngas khyed cag rkyen gang dag gis 'di ni nang ngo //🔽'di ni phyi @186a *//
analyzed: ngas khyed cag rkyen gang dag gis 'di ni nang ngo // 'di ni phyi @186a *//
translated: I will provide you with whatever conditions you need🔽so that you will not conceptualize, thinking, “This is internal,”

original: rol lo // 'di ni nang dang phyi rol lo zhes rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur pa de lta bu'i rkyen dag nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: rol lo // 'di ni nang dang phyi rol lo zhes rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur pa de lta bu'i rkyen dag nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: “This is external,” or “This is internal and external.”’

original: der byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can de dag la rkyen gang dang gang dag gis rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rkyen dag nye bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: der byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can de dag la rkyen gang dang gang dag gis rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rkyen dag nye bar sgrub par byed do //
translated: There, the bodhisattva great being will provide those sentient beings with whatever conditions they need so that they will not conceptualize.

original: des sems can de dag rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun chad nas bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: des sems can de dag rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun chad nas bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: When those sentient beings have cut off conceptualization, they will accomplish and dwell in the first concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and he accomplishes and dwells in the second, third, and fourth concentrations.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dag la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dag la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: He enters into the meditative absorption of loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de dag bsam gtan de dag dang / tshad med pa de dag gis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de dag bsam gtan de dag dang / tshad med pa de dag gis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag sgom par byed do //
translated: Through those concentrations and those formless [absorptions], he cultivates up to the eightfold noble path.

original: de dag bsgoms nas theg pa gsum po dag gis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bsgoms nas theg pa gsum po dag gis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having cultivated them, he gradually attains nirvāṇa through the three vehicles.

original: de dag las kha cig ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du byang chub kyi lam las yongs su mi nyams te /
analyzed: de dag las kha cig ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du byang chub kyi lam las yongs su mi nyams te /
translated: Some of them do not fall away from the path to enlightenment until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of generosity

original: sems can rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They cause sentient beings to be endowed with the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub @186b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub @186b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving

original: sems can rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su sdud pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su sdud pa yin zhe na /
translated: include sentient beings within the perfection of wisdom?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can shes rab 'chal pa dag mthong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can shes rab 'chal pa dag mthong na /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings see sentient beings with poor wisdom

original: 'di skad du kye sems can dag /
analyzed: 'di skad du kye sems can dag /
translated: they instruct and teach them, saying, ‘Hey, sentient beings!

original: khyed cag ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par mi byed ces 'doms shing rjes su ston par byed do //🔽de dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: khyed cag ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par mi byed ces 'doms shing rjes su ston par byed do // de dag 'di skad du /
translated: Why don’t you cultivate the perfection of wisdom?’

original: rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
translated: “They say, ‘Because we do not have the conditions.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of giving

original: sems can de dag la 'di skad du /
analyzed: sems can de dag la 'di skad du /
translated: say to those sentient beings, ‘Come here, you good people!

original: kye sems can dag /🔽nga las yo byad dag long zhig /
analyzed: kye sems can dag / nga las yo byad dag long zhig /
translated: O sentient beings,🔽take from me whatever you need.

original: nga las yo byad dag blangs nas kyang sbyin pa byin cig /
analyzed: nga las yo byad dag blangs nas kyang sbyin pa byin cig /
translated: Having taken from me whatever you need, give gifts.

original: tshul khrims srungs shig /🔽bzod pa sgrubs shig /
analyzed: tshul khrims srungs shig / bzod pa sgrubs shig /
translated: Guard morality.🔽Cultivate patience.

original: brtson 'grus rtsoms shig /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsoms shig /
translated: Exert effort.

original: bsam gtan sgoms shig /
analyzed: bsam gtan sgoms shig /
translated: Meditate on concentration.

original: rnam pa de dag yongs su rdzogs nas kyang 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag yongs su rdzogs nas kyang 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa la /
translated: Having perfected those aspects, also cultivate the perfection of wisdom in this way.

original: bdag gam / sems can nam /
analyzed: bdag gam / sems can nam /
translated: Do not settle into the notion that there is a self, a sentient being,

original: srog gam / gso ba'am /
analyzed: srog gam / gso ba'am /
translated: a life-force, a nourished being,

original: gang zag gam /
analyzed: gang zag gam /
translated: a person,

original: shes pa po dang / mthong ba po dang / byed pa po'i bar dag gam /
analyzed: shes pa po dang / mthong ba po dang / byed pa po'i bar dag gam /
translated: or even up to a knower and a seer and a doer.

original: 'dod pa'i khams sam /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams sam /
translated: Do not settle into the notion that there is the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: the form realm,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams sam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams sam /
translated: or the formless realm.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gam /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gam /
translated: Do not settle into the notion that there are the six perfections,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nam /🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i @187a *//
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nam / rgyun du zhugs pa'i @187a *//
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽or the result of stream enterer,

original: 'bras bu'am / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu'am / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of non-returner,🔽or the state of a worthy one.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: the fruit of an arhat,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: gang dmigs par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang yod dam /🔽tshol cig ces 'doms shing rjes su ston to //
analyzed: gang dmigs par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang yod dam / tshol cig ces 'doms shing rjes su ston to //
translated: Do you see any dharma at all that you could apprehend?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gang la dmigs shing mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gang la dmigs shing mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend any dharma at all that they could apprehend and become fixated on.

original: de mngon par zhen pa med pas chos gang yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: de mngon par zhen pa med pas chos gang yang skye ba'am /
translated: Since they are not fixated, they do not see any dharma as produced,🔽ceasing, defiled,

original: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am / rnam par byang bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: or purified.

original: des de dag yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas 'di ni sems can dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: des de dag yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas 'di ni sems can dmyal ba'o //
translated: Since they do not see them, they do not see any sentient beings in the hells,

original: 'di ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'o //
translated: in the animal world,

original: 'di ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: in the world of Yama,

original: 'di ni lha ma yin gyi ris so //
analyzed: 'di ni lha ma yin gyi ris so //
translated: or in the god or human realms.

original: 'di ni lha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha'o //
translated: This is a god.

original: 'di ni mi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi'o //
translated: This is a human.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This one has morality.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'o //
translated: This one has faulty morality.

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: This one is a stream enterer.

original: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: This one is a once-returner.

original: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: This one is a non-returner.

original: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: This one is a worthy one.

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: This one is a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya bar rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya bar rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: This one is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub @187b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub @187b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of generosity in that manner bring sentient beings into the fold through the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas /
translated: “Su­bhūti, how do great bodhisattva beings, after abiding in the transcendent perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: “How do they, standing in the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag yongs su 'dzin par byed ce na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag yongs su 'dzin par byed ce na /
translated: take up the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can rnams la yo byad dag sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can rnams la yo byad dag sbyin par byed de /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings give things to beings.

original: yo byad de dag gis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can rnams ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi sgom par byed do //
analyzed: yo byad de dag gis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can rnams ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi sgom par byed do //
translated: Those beings who are drawn in by those things cultivate the four applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi sgom par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi sgom par byed do //
translated: cultivate the four right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi sgom par byed do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi sgom par byed do //
translated: cultivate the four legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dag sgom par byed do //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dag sgom par byed do //
translated: and he cultivates the five powers, the five strengths, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: lam des yongs su zin par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: lam des yongs su zin par gyur pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti, those who are supported by this path🔽will be liberated from saṃsāra.

original: 'khor ba ji snyed pa las yongs su thar bar 'gyur te; rab 'byor /
analyzed: 'khor ba ji snyed pa las yongs su thar bar 'gyur te; rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi sems can rnams yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin no //🔽rab 'byor / @188a *//
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi sems can rnams yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin no // rab 'byor / @188a *//
translated: this is how bodhisattva great beings support beings with the noble dharmas that are free from defilements.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /🔽sems can mgon med pa sdug bsngal pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa / sems can mgon med pa sdug bsngal pa /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of generosity🔽see beings who are unprotected, suffering,

original: zas dang skom gyis phongs pa dag mthong na /
analyzed: zas dang skom gyis phongs pa dag mthong na /
translated: and lacking food and drink.

original: 'di ltar yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: They bring them to full maturity in the following way:

original: rigs kyi bu dag tshur shog /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag tshur shog /
translated: ‘Come, sons of noble family!

original: khyed cag nga las zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / bzhon pa dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / rin po che sna bdun dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag long la /
analyzed: khyed cag nga las zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / bzhon pa dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / rin po che sna bdun dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag long la /
translated: such as food, drink, clothes, vehicles, bedding, seats, perfumes, garlands, ointments, and the seven precious substances, up to and including any requisite articles.

original: sems can rnams la phan thogs shig dang / de ni khyed cag la yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan thogs shig dang / de ni khyed cag la yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Help sentient beings, and that will be for your long-term benefit, welfare, and happiness.’

original: 'di ni nga'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i don yin gyi /
translated: You should not think, ‘This is for my benefit,

original: khyed cag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed cag gi ma yin no //
translated: not for yours.’

original: snyam du bsam par mi bya bar 'di ni bdag gis yun ring po nas sems can rnams kyi don du bsgrubs pa yin no snyam du de ltar khyed kyis bdag rang gi yin no snyam du soms la /
analyzed: snyam du bsam par mi bya bar 'di ni bdag gis yun ring po nas sems can rnams kyi don du bsgrubs pa yin no snyam du de ltar khyed kyis bdag rang gi yin no snyam du soms la /
translated: You should think, ‘This is for me, because I have been working for the welfare of sentient beings for a long time.’

original: sems can rnams la sbyin pa byin cig /
analyzed: sems can rnams la sbyin pa byin cig /
translated: Give gifts to sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa des kyang tshul khrims la sbyor cig /🔽bzod pa la sbyor cig /
analyzed: sbyin pa des kyang tshul khrims la sbyor cig / bzod pa la sbyor cig /
translated: Through that generosity, connect them to morality.🔽Connect them to patience.

original: brtson 'grus la sbyor cig /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la sbyor cig /
translated: Connect them to perseverance.

original: ting nge 'dzin la sbyor cig /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sbyor cig /
translated: Apply yourself to meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gtan la sbyor cig /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sbyor cig /
translated: Apply yourself to meditative absorption.

original: shes rab la sbyor cig /
analyzed: shes rab la sbyor cig /
translated: Apply yourself to wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag la sbyor cig /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag la sbyor cig /
translated: Apply yourself to the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: de tsam gyis chog bar ma 'dzin par gong du 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa rnams la'ang @188b khod cig /
analyzed: de tsam gyis chog bar ma 'dzin par gong du 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa rnams la'ang @188b khod cig /
translated: Do not be satisfied with just that, but apply yourself to the higher, to the uncontaminated dharmas of the Āryas.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la khod cig ces /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la khod cig ces /
translated: Apply yourself to the fruit of entering the stream, to the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, to the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, to arhatship, to individual enlightenment, and to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji ltar yongs su smin par byas pas sems can rnams ngan song gsum po dag las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba dang 'khor ba thams cad kyi bar🔽dag las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba de ltar sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji ltar yongs su smin par byas pas sems can rnams ngan song gsum po dag las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba dang 'khor ba thams cad kyi bar dag las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba de ltar sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should bring beings to maturity so that they will be freed from the three lower realms and🔽from all the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings, abiding in the perfection of morality,

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: should bring beings to maturity in this way.

original: rigs kyi bu dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag tshur sheg /
translated: “Come, sons of good family!

original: khyed zas sam /
analyzed: khyed zas sam /
translated: Do you have food?

original: skom mam / mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag gis phongs nas tshul khrims 'chal par byed pa'i yo byad de dag ngas nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes des sems can de dag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod nas kyang phan gdags pa ji lta
analyzed: skom mam / mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag gis phongs nas tshul khrims 'chal par byed pa'i yo byad de dag ngas nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes des sems can de dag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod nas kyang phan gdags pa ji lta
translated: I will provide them with whatever they need, up to and including human necessities, so that they will not be deprived and will not break the precepts.

original: bus phan btags pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par len par 'gyur zhing tshul khrims ma ral ba dang / tshul khrims nag nog med par gyur pa de dag tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i @189a *//
analyzed: bus phan btags pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par len par 'gyur zhing tshul khrims ma ral ba dang / tshul khrims nag nog med par gyur pa de dag tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i @189a *//
translated: ’ Having established those beings in the perfection of morality, he benefits them in such a way that they take up the path of the ten wholesome courses of action, and that they become established in the restraint of the precepts, with their morality unbroken and without blemish.

original: phan gdags pas phan 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: phan gdags pas phan 'dogs par byed de /
translated: He benefits them by benefiting them in this way.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bar dag la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bar dag la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same method applies up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: From the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i go cha'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa drug pa'o ////
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i go cha'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa drug pa'o ////
translated: This concludes “The Armor of the Perfection of Wisdom,” the thirty-sixth chapter of the “Mother” Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti thought this:

original: gang la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de lta bu'i go cha bgo bar bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam de gang yin snyam mo //
analyzed: gang la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de lta bu'i go cha bgo bar bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam de gang yin snyam mo //
translated: “What is the path of a bodhisattva mahāsattva on which a bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand and don such armor?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi sems kyi yongs su rtogs pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi sems kyi yongs su rtogs pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas /
translated: Then the Lord, knowing in his mind the thoughts that had arisen in the mind of the venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: said this to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam mo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam mo //
translated: “Subhūti, the six perfections are the path of a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam mo //
translated: The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are the path of a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam mo //
translated: The four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four foundations for supernormal powers, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path are the bodhisattva great beings’ path.🔽The three gateways to liberation, the eight deliverances, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten universal bases, the four noble truths, the four formless states, the five governing powers, the five governing abilities, the six sense fields of contact, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path are the bodhisattva great beings’ path.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed discernments, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are the bodhisattva great beings’ path.

original: rab 'byor / yang chos thams @189b cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang chos thams @189b cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam yin no //
translated: Su­bhūti, all phenomena are the bodhisattva great beings’ path.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Su­bhūti, what do you think of this?

original: gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par mi bya ba dang / gang la ma bslabs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par mi bya ba dang / gang la ma bslabs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that there are any phenomena in which the bodhisattva great beings should not train, and by not training in which they would attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment?”🔽“

original: rab 'byor / gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par mi bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la ma bslab par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par nus pa'i chos ni gang yang med do //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par mi bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la ma bslab par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par nus pa'i chos ni gang yang med do // de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Subhuti: If all dharmas are empty, how can the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has stood in emptiness, perfect the four applications of mindfulness, etc. to: the knowledge of all modes?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.🔽All dharmas are empty.

original: gal te chos thams cad stong pa lags na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la ji ltar bslab par bgyi ste /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong pa lags na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la ji ltar bslab par bgyi ste /
translated: In emptiness, Subhuti, there is no form, no feeling, no perception, no impulses, no consciousness;🔽no eye, no ear, no nose, no tongue, no body, no mind;

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di snyed cig go zhe'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / 'di snyed cig go zhe'am /
translated: no form, no sound, no smell, no taste, no touch, no thing;🔽no element of eye up to no element of mind;🔽no element of form up to no element of mental objects;🔽no element of eye-consciousness up to no element of mind-consciousness;

original: 'di dag go zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di dag go zhe'am /
translated: no element of eye-contact up to no element of mind-contact;

original: chos 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: no suffering, origination, stopping, or path;🔽no cognition and realization of the fruit of Streamwinner, etc. to: no cognition and realization of the supreme enlightenment;

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽zag pa med pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am / zag pa dang bcas pa'am / zag pa med pa'am /
translated: no world of beings, no world of what belongs to a being;

original: 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas sam /
translated: no world of the skandhas, no world of the elements, no world of the sense-fields;🔽no world of the perfections, no world of the elements leading to enlightenment, no world of the fruits of a holy life, no world of the Buddha-dharmas;

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: no world of conditioned coproduction;🔽no world of the perfections, no world of the trances, no world of the formless attainments;

original: so so skye bo'i chos sam /
analyzed: so so skye bo'i chos sam /
translated: no world of the applications of mindfulness, etc. to: no world of the Buddhadharmas;🔽no world of the fruits of a Streamwinner, etc. to: no world of a Pratyekabuddha;🔽no world of a Bodhisattva, no world of a Buddha;🔽no world of the knowledge of all modes;🔽no world of the cognition of the knowledge of all modes;🔽no world of the cognition of the knowledge of all modes;🔽no world of the cognition of the knowledge of all modes;🔽no world of the cognition of the knowledge of all modes;🔽no world of the cognition of the knowledge of all modes;🔽no world of the cognition

original: dgra bcom pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i chos sam /
translated: the dharmas of an arhat,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos lags so zhes bgyis na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos lags so zhes bgyis na /
translated: or the dharmas of a pratyekabuddha?”🔽“If I were to elaborate on that,

original: ma spros pa spros par bgyid pa'am /🔽gcig tu mi @190a *//
analyzed: ma spros pa spros par bgyid pa'am / gcig tu mi @190a *//
translated: would I be fabricating something that is not so,

original: 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: 'gyur lags sam /
translated: or would I be saying something that is not one?”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him, “Lord, if all dharmas are empty of all dharmas, how, Lord, will a bodhisattva great being, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, turn the wheel of the Dharma?

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: chos thams cad ni stong pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni stong pa yin no //
translated: All dharmas are empty.

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad stong pa ma yin du zin na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad stong pa ma yin du zin na ni /
translated: Subhūti, if all dharmas were not empty,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: bodhisattva great beings would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are empty

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni stong pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni stong pa yin te /
translated: that

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / yang gang khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang gang khyod 'di skad du /
translated: “Subhūti, you asked

original: gal te chos thams cad stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong pa lags na /
translated: ‘If all dharmas are empty,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di snyed cig go zhe'am /
