analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di snyed cig go zhe'am /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings distinguish dharmas—

original: 'di dag go zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di dag go zhe'am /
translated: this many or this many,

original: so so skye bo'i chos sam /
analyzed: so so skye bo'i chos sam /
translated: or dharmas of ordinary persons,

original: dgra bcom pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i chos sam /
translated: or dharmas of worthy ones,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bgyi ba'i bar du ji ltar chos rnams tha dad du bgyid ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bgyi ba'i bar du ji ltar chos rnams tha dad du bgyid ces zer ba ni /
translated: or dharmas of pratyekabuddhas, up to dharmas of buddhas?’

original: rab 'byor / ci sems can 'di dag gis chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar shes sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci sems can 'di dag gis chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar shes sam /
translated: “Subhūti, do these beings know that all dharmas are empty?

original: gal te de ltar shes na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang chos thams cad la bslabs nas /
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang chos thams cad la bslabs nas /
translated: If they knew that, bodhisattva great beings, having trained in all dharmas,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @190b nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @190b nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: but they do not attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sems can 'di dag gis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sems can 'di dag gis /
translated: Subhūti, it is because these beings

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar mi shes te /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar mi shes te /
translated: do not know that all phenomena are empty.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos thams cad rnam par bzhag par byas shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par bzhag par byas shing /
translated: having arranged all phenomena,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston par byed do //
translated: teach the Dharma to beings.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, in that regard, bodhisattva great beings practicing the awakening path

original: thog ma nyid nas 'di ltar 'di la mngon par 'du byed pa ma gtogs par gang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do snyam du nye bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma nyid nas 'di ltar 'di la mngon par 'du byed pa ma gtogs par gang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do snyam du nye bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: should first of all thoroughly investigate as follows: ‘Except for the designation, there is no phenomenon whatsoever that would be apprehended by way of its intrinsic nature.’

original: de ltar chos de dag gis rang bzhin la nye bar rtog pa na /
analyzed: de ltar chos de dag gis rang bzhin la nye bar rtog pa na /
translated: When they investigate the nature of phenomena in this way,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sam /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sam /
translated: they do not settle down on the perfections,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nam /
translated: the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of entering the stream,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: arhatship,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: individual enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: They do not settle down on any phenomenon at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
translated: Because all phenomena are empty of the intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par mi byed de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par mi byed de /
translated: Emptiness does not settle down on emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: Since emptiness is not apprehended,

original: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa lta smos @191a *//
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa lta smos @191a *//
translated: how could emptiness settle down on emptiness?

original: kyang ci dgos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kyang ci dgos pa'i phyir te /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de ltar chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de ltar chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par gnas so //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings thus stand without apprehending anything in all dharmas.

original: de bslab pa de la gnas nas kyang /
analyzed: de bslab pa de la gnas nas kyang /
translated: And standing in that training,

original: sems can 'di dag ci la spyod ces sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa la rnam par lta zhing med pa la 'dzin pa yin no //🔽snyam nas / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ci la spyod ces sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa la rnam par lta zhing med pa la 'dzin pa yin no // snyam nas / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: they look at the activities of all beings, thinking, ‘These beings are attached to what does not exist.’

original: kye ma bdag gis sems can 'di dag yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa las legs par thar bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: kye ma bdag gis sems can 'di dag yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa las legs par thar bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “Then, bodhisattva great beings think, ‘Alas! I must free these beings from attachment to what does not exist.’

original: de thabs la mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: de thabs la mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “Then, skilled in means, they stand in the perfection of wisdom

original: 'di skad du sems can dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: 'di skad du sems can dag tshur sheg /
translated: and say, ‘Come here, beings!

original: khyed cag sbyin pa byin cig dang / des khyed cag longs spyod dag gis mi brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed cag sbyin pa byin cig dang / des khyed cag longs spyod dag gis mi brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Give gifts, and you will not be short of enjoyments.

original: longs spyod de dag gis kyang rlom sems sum byed cig /
analyzed: longs spyod de dag gis kyang rlom sems sum byed cig /
translated: But do not be conceited about those enjoyments.

original: de la snying po gang yang med do zhes 'doms par byed do //🔽de bzhin du tshul khrims bsrungs la /
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do zhes 'doms par byed do // de bzhin du tshul khrims bsrungs la /
translated: There is nothing substantial there.”

original: tshul khrims des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: tshul khrims des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: “Do not be proud because of that patience.

original: de la snying po gang yang med do zhes tshul khrims la 'doms par byed do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do zhes tshul khrims la 'doms par byed do //
translated: There is nothing substantial there.”🔽“Do not be proud because of that perseverance.🔽There is nothing substantial there.”

original: de bzhin du bzod pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs shig /🔽de bzhin du shes rab sgoms shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs shig / de bzhin du shes rab sgoms shig /
translated: “Do not be proud because of that concentration.🔽There is nothing substantial there.”

original: shes rab des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: shes rab des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: “Do not be proud because of that wisdom.🔽There is nothing substantial there.”🔽“Do not be proud because of the result of stream enterer.🔽There is nothing substantial there.”🔽“Do not be proud because of the result of once-returner.

original: @191b de la snying po gang yang med do zhes 'doms par byed do //
analyzed: @191b de la snying po gang yang med do zhes 'doms par byed do //
translated: There is nothing substantial there.”🔽“Do not be proud because of the result of non-returner.🔽There is nothing substantial there.”🔽“Do not be proud because of the state of a worthy one.🔽There is nothing substantial there.”

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid dang / de bzhin du rang byang chub dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid dang / de bzhin du rang byang chub dang /
translated: “Do not be proud because of a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.🔽There is nothing substantial there.”

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag bsgoms la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar dag bsgoms la /
translated: In the same way, you should cultivate all the qualities of a buddha,

original: chos de dag gis kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: chos de dag gis kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: but do not be proud of those qualities.

original: de la snying po gang yang med do zhes 'doms par byed de /
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do zhes 'doms par byed de /
translated: There is nothing substantial there at all.

original: de ltar 'doms shing rjes su ston par byed pas byang chub kyi lam la spyod kyang /
analyzed: de ltar 'doms shing rjes su ston par byed pas byang chub kyi lam la spyod kyang /
translated: In this way, you should instruct and teach them, and although they practice the path to awakening,

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: they do not settle down on any dharma at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /
translated: All dharmas are without settling down,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nye bar bzung na /
translated: because if you take emptiness as the nature of all dharmas,

original: de la gang gis mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gang gis mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no essence whatsoever that could settle down on it.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod kyang /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, although bodhisattva great beings practice the path to awakening,

original: gang la'ang mi gnas te /
analyzed: gang la'ang mi gnas te /
translated: they do not settle down on anything at all.

original: de gnas med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de gnas med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: Although they practice the perfection of generosity, they do not rest in that, because it is not a basis.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: Although they practice the perfection of moral discipline, they do not rest in that.🔽Although they practice the perfection of patience, they do not rest in that.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de @192a *//
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so // bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de @192a *//
translated: Although they practice the perfection of perseverance, they do not rest in that.

original: la mi gnas so //
analyzed: la mi gnas so //
translated: Although they practice the perfection of concentration, they do not rest in that.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: Although they practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not rest in that.🔽Although they enter into the first concentration, they do not rest in that.

original: de bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas so; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas so; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po ni bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po ni bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
translated: Because the first concentration is empty of the intrinsic nature of the first concentration.

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa de'ang stong zhing rnam pa gang dag gis snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa de'ang stong zhing rnam pa gang dag gis snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who enters meditative absorption is empty, and the aspects by which one enters meditative absorption are also empty.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag dang /
translated: Similarly, from the second concentration up to the third concentration and the fourth concentration, and similarly, from loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, up to the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: and the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, and the fruit of stream enterer, but they do not rest in that.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They attain the fruit of once-returner, but they do not rest in that.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They attain the fruit of non-returner, but they do not rest in that.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They attain the state of a worthy one, but they do not rest in that.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: even though they have attained the level of a pratyekabuddha, they do not rest in that.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du mi gnas lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du mi gnas lags /
translated: why do they not rest?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa gnyis kyis mi gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa gnyis kyis mi gnas te /
translated: “Subhūti, they do not rest in two ways.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?🔽There is no intrinsic nature of those results in which they would rest, by which they would rest, or on which they would rest.

original: 'bras bu de dag la gang la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / @192b gang gis gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gang gnas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin par bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de dag la gang la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / @192b gang gis gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gang gnas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin par bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, they do not think, ‘That much is enough,’ and they do not fail to attain the result of stream enterer.

original: bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob nas kyang de la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob nas kyang de la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Having attained the result of stream enterer, they do not rest in that.

original: bdag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar dag thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar dag thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: They do not fail to attain the level of a pratyekabuddha.

original: bdag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob kyang de la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob kyang de la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Even if I attain the level of a pratyekabuddha, I will not remain there.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar bdag gis sems dang po bskyed phyin chad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma gtogs par sems gzhan ma bskyed do snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis sems dang po bskyed phyin chad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma gtogs par sems gzhan ma bskyed do snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because I have thought, ‘Since I first gave rise to bodhicitta, I have not given rise to any other thought except for the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems dang po bskyed phyin chad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma gtogs par sems gzhan ma bskyed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems dang po bskyed phyin chad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma gtogs par sems gzhan ma bskyed la /
translated: Because that bodhisattva mahāsattva, since first giving rise to bodhicitta, has not given rise to any other thought except for the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Similarly, from the time of entering into the bodhisattva faultless state

original: sa bcu'i bar du'ang sems rnam par g-yeng ba med cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma gtogs par sems gzhan 'ga' yang ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu'i bar du'ang sems rnam par g-yeng ba med cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma gtogs par sems gzhan 'ga' yang ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the tenth level, he has no distracted thoughts and has not given rise to any other thought except for the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ji tsam du lus dang / ngag dang / @193a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ji tsam du lus dang / ngag dang / @193a *//
translated: Subhuti : How much does the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has set out for the supreme enlightenment, increase in the wholesome roots when he has stood in the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained, and has developed it?🔽

original: yid kyis rtul bar byed pa'ang byang chub kyi sems las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyis rtul bar byed pa'ang byang chub kyi sems las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s practice with body, speech, and mind is nothing other than the mind of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi sems la gnas shing yid rnam par mi g-yeng bar byang chub kyi lam skyed par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi sems la gnas shing yid rnam par mi g-yeng bar byang chub kyi lam skyed par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in the mind of awakening, generates the path to awakening without a distracted mind.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad skye ba ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad skye ba ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are unborn,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam bskyed par bgyid lags /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam bskyed par bgyid lags /
translated: how does the bodhisattva mahāsattva generate the path to awakening?”🔽When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhuti: So it is, O Lord.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: So it is, O Well-Gone.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: All dharmas are unproduced.

original: de'ang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: gang dag mngon par 'du mi byed pa de dag la ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin no //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: gang dag mngon par 'du mi byed pa de dag la ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin no // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Those who do not form anything have all dharmas unproduced.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhuti said to him:🔽Subhuti: Is it not so that

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether Tathagatas are produced or not,

original: chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid de ni gnas pa ma lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid de ni gnas pa ma lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: the dharma-element remains just as it is?

original: rab 'byor / de de @193b bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de @193b bzhin no //
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti.

original: de de bzhin te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: So it is,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether Tathagatas are produced or not,

original: chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid de ni gnas pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid de ni gnas pa yin mod kyi /
translated: the dharma-element remains just as it is.

original: gang dag gis chos gnas pa nyid de mi shes pa de dag gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam bskyed par byed cing lam des sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar byed do //
analyzed: gang dag gis chos gnas pa nyid de mi shes pa de dag gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam bskyed par byed cing lam des sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar byed do //
translated: For the sake of those who do not know the abiding nature of phenomena, the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas generate the path to enlightenment and through that path liberate beings from saṃsāra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ci skyes par gyur ba'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ci skyes par gyur ba'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam /
translated: is enlightenment attained through a path that has arisen?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: 'o na ma skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na ma skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Well then, is enlightenment attained through a path that has not arisen?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na skyes kyang skyes la /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na skyes kyang skyes la /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: ma skyes kyang ma skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ma skyes kyang ma skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Well then, is enlightenment attained through a path that has arisen and not arisen?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:🔽No, it is not.

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not like that.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na skyes pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na skyes pa'ang ma lags /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: ma skyes pa'ang ma lags par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'ang ma lags par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam /
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, is awakening attained by a path that is neither produced nor unproduced?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not like that.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub thob par 'gyur lags /🔽de skad @194a *//
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub thob par 'gyur lags / de skad @194a *//
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, how is awakening attained?”

original: ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub ni lam gyis kyang mi 'thob la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub ni lam gyis kyang mi 'thob la /
translated: “Subhūti, awakening is not attained by a path,

original: lam ma yin pas kyang ma yin te /🔽byang chub nyid kyang lam mo //
analyzed: lam ma yin pas kyang ma yin te / byang chub nyid kyang lam mo //
translated: nor is it attained by what is not a path.🔽Awakening itself is the path.

original: lam nyid kyang byang chub bo /
analyzed: lam nyid kyang byang chub bo /
translated: The path itself is awakening.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te byang chub nyid kyang lam lags la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub nyid kyang lam lags la /
translated: if awakening itself is the path,

original: lam nyid kyang byang chub lags na /
analyzed: lam nyid kyang byang chub lags na /
translated: If the path itself is awakening,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub thob lags pa nyid du mi 'gyur lags sam /🔽'o na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub thob lags pa nyid du mi 'gyur lags sam / 'o na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: then is it not the case that bodhisattva great beings have already attained awakening?🔽Then why is it taught that a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha is endowed with the thirty-two major marks of a great being, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of exact knowledge, the four forms of unerring knowledge, the four forms of complete knowledge, the five forms of spiritual vision, the six forms of clairvoyance, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the three forms of clear knowledge, the four noble truths, the twelve links of dependent origination, the four forms of correct understanding, the four forms of meditative equipoise, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of exact knowledge, the four forms of unerring knowledge, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and the great love and great compassion?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lags so zhes kyang ci'i slad du bstan lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lags so zhes kyang ci'i slad du bstan lags /
translated: Why is it taught that a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha is endowed with the thirty-two major marks of a great being, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of exact knowledge, the four forms of unerring knowledge, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and the great love and great compassion?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Venerable Subhūti having thus inquired, the Lord said to him,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sangs rgyas kyis byang chub @194b thob snyam mam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis byang chub @194b thob snyam mam /
translated: “Do you think that the Buddha has attained awakening?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /🔽sangs rgyas nyid kyang byang chub lags la /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te / sangs rgyas nyid kyang byang chub lags la /
translated: no, I do not.🔽Buddhahood is awakening,

original: byang chub nyid kyang sangs rgyas lags pas /
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang sangs rgyas lags pas /
translated: and awakening is buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas kyis byang chub mi 'thob lags so //🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis byang chub mi 'thob lags so // bka' stsal pa /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha has not attained awakening.”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gang yang khyod 'di skad du 'o na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang yang khyod 'di skad du 'o na /
translated: “Subhūti, you said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub thob lags pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub thob lags pa'am /
translated: ‘Well then, has the bodhisattva great being attained awakening,

original: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags sam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags sam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: or not?’

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, having completed the six perfections,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: and having completed the thirty-seven aspects of awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
translated: and having perfected the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: he will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by means of the vajropama meditative stabilization and the wisdom that occurs in a single instant.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas phyin chad /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas phyin chad /
translated: And after fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod de /
translated: he will be called a tathāgata.

original: chos thams cad mkhyen cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad mkhyen cing /
translated: He will know all dharmas

original: chos thams cad gzigs pas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzigs pas na /
translated: and will see all dharmas.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he will be called omniscient.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab @195a *//🔽'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab @195a *// 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na /
translated: If all dharmas are isolated from their own-marks,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid lags /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid lags /
translated: how do Bodhisattvas purify a Buddha-field?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Here, Subhūti, from the time when the Bodhisattva first produces the thought of enlightenment,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong bar byed cing yongs su dag pa'i chos de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong bar byed cing yongs su dag pa'i chos de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: he purifies the physical, verbal, and mental faults of himself and others, and by means of those purified dharmas he purifies a Buddha-field.”🔽The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him:

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi gnas ngan len ni gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi gnas ngan len ni gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ physical misdeed?

original: ngag gi gnas ngan lan ni gang lags /
analyzed: ngag gi gnas ngan lan ni gang lags /
translated: What is the verbal misdeed?

original: yid kyi gnas ngan len ni gang lags /
analyzed: yid kyi gnas ngan len ni gang lags /
translated: What is the mental misdeed?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / lus kyi las mi dge ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / lus kyi las mi dge ba 'di lta ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, the physical misdeed is as follows:

original: srog @195b gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / ngag gi las mi dge ba brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig bkyal bar smra ba dang /
analyzed: srog @195b gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / ngag gi las mi dge ba brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig bkyal bar smra ba dang /
translated: killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct; the verbal misdeed is lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk;

original: yid kyi las mi dge ba brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yid kyi las mi dge ba brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: and the mental misdeed is covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: These are the bodhisattva great beings’ physical misdeed.

original: de ni ngag gi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: de ni ngag gi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: This is the verbal negative reflex.

original: de ni yid kyi gnas ngan len yin te /
analyzed: de ni yid kyi gnas ngan len yin te /
translated: This is the mental negative reflex.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len de dag yongs su sbyong zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len de dag yongs su sbyong zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: The Bodhisattva-mahāsattva, purifying these negative reflexes of body, speech, and mind in himself and in others, purifies the Buddha-field.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang ser sna'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang ser sna'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the thought of avarice is a mental negative reflex of the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sems dang / 'khrug pa'i sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sems dang / 'khrug pa'i sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: The thought of immorality, the thought of anger, the thought of sloth, the thought of distraction, the thought of confused ignorance, and the thought of false wisdom are mental negative reflexes of the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pa gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pa gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the impurity of morality is also a mental flaw of bodhisattva great beings.

original: @196a *// rab 'byor /
analyzed: @196a *// rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: gzhan yang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang bral ba gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang bral ba gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: the lack of the four establishments of mindfulness is also a mental flaw of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: Similarly, the lack of the four right efforts, the four legs of magical emanation, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the meditative absorption of emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang bral ba gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang bral ba gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: The absence of the meditative stabilization of emptiness, the absence of the meditative stabilization of signlessness, and the absence of the meditative stabilization of wishlessness are also mental defilements of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed cing de la dga' ba gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed cing de la dga' ba gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the direct realization of the result of stream enterer and delighting in that is also a mental defilement of bodhisattva great beings.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyi bar dag mngon sum du byed cing /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyi bar dag mngon sum du byed cing /
translated: The direct realization of up to the state of a worthy one and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening

original: de la dga' ba gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: de la dga' ba gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: and delighting in that is also a mental defilement of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gzugs su 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gzugs su 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the perception of form is a mental defilement.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa ni @196b gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa ni @196b gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: The notion of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is a negative conditioning.

original: mig tu 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: mig tu 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: The notion of eye is a negative conditioning.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: The notion of ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind is a negative conditioning.

original: bud med du 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: bud med du 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: The notion of a woman is a negative conditioning.

original: skyes par 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: skyes par 'du shes pa ni gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: The notion of a man is a negative conditioning.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su 'du shes pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / dge bar 'du shes pa dang / mi dge bar 'du shes pa dang / 'dus byas su 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su 'du shes pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / dge bar 'du shes pa dang / mi dge bar 'du shes pa dang / 'dus byas su 'du shes pa dang /
translated: The notion of the desire realm, the notion of the form realm, the notion of the formless realm, the notion of wholesome, the notion of unwholesome, the notion of compounded,

original: 'dus ma byas su 'du shes pa gang yin pa de'ang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su 'du shes pa gang yin pa de'ang /
translated: and the notion of uncompounded

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: are, Subhūti, negative conditioning for bodhisattva great beings.

original: ngag gi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: ngag gi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: It is a fault of speech.

original: yid kyi gnas ngan len yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi gnas ngan len yin te /
translated: It is a fault of mind.

original: des gnas ngan len de dag thams cad rnam par spangs nas bdag kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: des gnas ngan len de dag thams cad rnam par spangs nas bdag kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing /
translated: Having abandoned all those faults, they give gifts themselves🔽and they encourage others to give gifts.

original: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste; de zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas sbyin par byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste; de zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas sbyin par byed /
translated: They give food to those who want food,

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom sbyin par byed /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom sbyin par byed /
translated: drink to those who want drink,

original: yo byad 'dod pa rnams la ni yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag sbyin par byed la /🔽gzhan dag kyang yo byad de dag nyid la rab tu 'god cing /
analyzed: yo byad 'dod pa rnams la ni yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag sbyin par byed la / gzhan dag kyang yo byad de dag nyid la rab tu 'god cing /
translated: and they give whatever articles they need up to all the articles.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas sangs @197a *//
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste / dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas sangs @197a *//
translated: They establish others in those articles and encourage them.

original: rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed de /
analyzed: rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed de /
translated: They make that root of virtue common to all and dedicate it to the purification of a Buddha-field.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽de bdag kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // de bdag kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ste /
translated: The same should be applied to morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi phyir sbyin pa sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi phyir sbyin pa sbyin par byed la /
translated: “He himself fills the great trichiliocosm with the seven precious substances and gives it as a gift to the Three Jewels,

original: gzhan dag kyang de nyid la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de nyid la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing /
translated: and he also encourages others to do the same.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna bdun las grub par gyur cig ces de ltar yongs su bsngo bar byed do //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas rnams sam /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna bdun las grub par gyur cig ces de ltar yongs su bsngo bar byed do // rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas rnams sam /
translated: He dedicates the wholesome roots to the attainment of a buddhafield made of the seven precious substances.🔽“Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas play divine music in the presence of the buddhas

original: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten gyi drung du lha'i sil snyan dag dkrol bar byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten gyi drung du lha'i sil snyan dag dkrol bar byed cing /
translated: or in the presence of stūpas of the Tathāgatas.

original: de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du lha'i sil snyan gyi sgra yid du 'ong ba dag rtag tu rgyun mi chad par 'byung bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du lha'i sil snyan gyi sgra yid du 'ong ba dag rtag tu rgyun mi chad par 'byung bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates it in this way: ‘Through this wholesome action, may the sounds of divine musical instruments be constantly and uninterruptedly heard in my Buddha-field.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha'i spos kyis yongs su bkang ste /🔽sangs rgyas rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha'i spos kyis yongs su bkang ste / sangs rgyas rnams sam /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva fills the worlds of a billion-world universe with divine incense🔽and offers it to the Buddhas

original: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten dag la 'bul zhing de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba @197b 'dis bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing der lha'i spos dag 'byung bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten dag la 'bul zhing de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba @197b 'dis bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing der lha'i spos dag 'byung bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: or to stūpas of the Tathāgatas. He dedicates it in this way: ‘Through this wholesome action, may the fragrance of divine incense be present in that Buddha-field of mine.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams la zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dag 'bul zhing de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i nyan
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams la zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dag 'bul zhing de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i nyan
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should give to the Tathagatas and to the disciples of the Tathagatas food and drink of a hundred tastes, and he should dedicate this wholesome root to the supreme enlightenment in this way:🔽 May this wholesome root of mine become a condition for the attainment of the thirty-two marks of a superman for beings!🔽

original: thos rnams kyi kha zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dag 'byor bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: thos rnams kyi kha zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dag 'byor bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings offer food with a hundred flavors to the tathāgatas and the tathāgatas’ śrāvakas, and they dedicate it in this way: ‘By this root of virtue, may the śrāvakas in my buddhafield, when I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, have food with a hundred flavors.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la lha'i byug pa dag 'bul zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la lha'i byug pa dag 'bul zhing /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings offer divine ointments to the tathāgatas, the tathāgatas’ śrāvakas, the tathāgatas’ images, and the tathāgatas’ stūpas, and they dedicate it in this way:

original: de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can rnams lha'i reg pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo🔽bar byed do //
analyzed: de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can rnams lha'i reg pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates it in this way: By this wholesome root, may the sentient beings in my buddha-field, when I have attained highest genuine full Awakening, have the excellent divine touch.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems te /🔽yid la bsams pa tsam nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams @198a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems te / yid la bsams pa tsam nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams @198a *//
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being thinks like this: By merely thinking of it, may the buddhas,

original: dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang / sems can thams cad la 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa yid du 'ong ba dag 'bul bar gyur cig /
analyzed: dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang / sems can thams cad la 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa yid du 'ong ba dag 'bul bar gyur cig /
translated: the buddhas' disciples, and all sentient beings be offered the five sense objects—forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches—that are pleasing.

original: snyam du sems shing de dag phul nas kyang /
analyzed: snyam du sems shing de dag phul nas kyang /
translated: Having offered them, may they be satisfied.

original: de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyis yid la bsams pa tsam gyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gzugs dang /
analyzed: de 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyis yid la bsams pa tsam gyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gzugs dang /
translated: He dedicates it in this way: ‘By this wholesome action, may I, having fully awakened to highest genuine full Awakening, have a Buddha-field in which all the members of the Community of Hearers and all sentient beings have at their disposal the five kinds of sense objects—

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya yid du 'ong ba dag 'byung bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya yid du 'ong ba dag 'byung bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects—merely by thinking of them.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag dang sems can thams cad lhan cig 'grogs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag dang sems can thams cad lhan cig 'grogs te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, together with all sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya yid du 'ong ba'i sbyin pa dag 'bul bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya yid du 'ong ba'i sbyin pa dag 'bul bar byed do //
translated: offer to the Buddhas and the Buddhas’ Hearers the gift of the five kinds of sense objects—forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects—that are pleasing.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom thinks like this:

original: 'di ltar bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: “Thus, I will enter into the first concentration.

original: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan dang po la gzud par @198b bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan dang po la gzud par @198b bya'o //
translated: I will also cause others to enter into the first concentration.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag la'ang gzung cing dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag la'ang gzung cing dgod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, I will cause them to enter into and abide in the fourth concentration.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag la dgod par bya'o snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag la dgod par bya'o snyam du sems shing /
translated: I will cause them to enter into and abide in the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.”

original: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad sbyin pa gnyis dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad sbyin pa gnyis dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig /
translated: He thinks, ‘By these wholesome roots, may all the sentient beings in that buddha-field of mine, when I have attained highest genuine full Awakening, never be separated from the two kinds of giving.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig /
translated: May they never be separated from the four concentrations,

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig ces /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig ces /
translated: the four immeasurables, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of Awakening.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /🔽de ji srid du bsam pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de / de ji srid du bsam pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du /
translated: Subhūti, in this way the bodhisattva great being purifies the buddha-field.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi byed de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi byed de /
translated: And he does not fully awaken to highest genuine full Awakening as long as all those wishes have not been fulfilled.

original: de bdag kyang dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de bdag kyang dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: He himself is endowed with all virtuous qualities,

original: sems can de dag kyang dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan par byed do //
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan par byed do //
translated: and he causes those sentient beings to be endowed with virtuous qualities.

original: de bdag kyang gzugs bzang ba yin la /🔽sems can gang dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang gzugs bzang ba yin te /
analyzed: de bdag kyang gzugs bzang ba yin la / sems can gang dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang gzugs bzang ba yin te /
translated: He himself has a good physical appearance,

original: de dag 'di lta ste /🔽bsod nams kyis yongs su @199a *//
analyzed: de dag 'di lta ste / bsod nams kyis yongs su @199a *//
translated: and those sentient beings who have been matured by that bodhisattva great being also have a good physical appearance.🔽They have a body that is good-looking,🔽beautiful, and attractive,

original: zin pa'i phyir gzugs bzad ba dang / blta na sdug pa dang / mdzes pa'i lus de mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: zin pa'i phyir gzugs bzad ba dang / blta na sdug pa dang / mdzes pa'i lus de mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: because they are favored by merit.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings purify a buddhafield like that.

original: ci nas kyang ngan song gsum po dag tu gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lta ba'i rnam par gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug tu gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ci nas kyang ngan song gsum po dag tu gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lta ba'i rnam par gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug tu gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: In this way, the three lower realms will not even be designated, and the designations of views, desire, anger, and ignorance will not occur.

original: skyes ba dang bud med ces bya ba'i ming yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / theg pa gnyis po dag gis ming yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag tu gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: skyes ba dang bud med ces bya ba'i ming yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / theg pa gnyis po dag gis ming yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag tu gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The names of male and female will not occur, and the names of the two vehicles will not occur. The designations of impermanence, suffering, and self will not occur.

original: yongs su 'dzin par gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin par gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rjes su 'chags pa dang kun nas ldang bar gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / phyin ci log tu gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin par gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rjes su 'chags pa dang kun nas ldang bar gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / phyin ci log tu gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: the designation of appropriation would not occur, the designation of grasping at “I” and grasping at “mine” would not occur, the designation of confession and concealment would not occur, the designation of error would not occur,

original: 'bras bu rnam par bzhag par gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par bzhag par gdags pa'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: and the designation of the presentation of the result would not occur.

original: gzhan du na stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgra 'byung ba dang / sems can de dag 'di ltar phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams gtong 'dod pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan du na stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgra 'byung ba dang / sems can de dag 'di ltar phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams gtong 'dod pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Otherwise, the sound of the meditative stabilization of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness would occur, and the sound of those sentient beings’ desire to give away outer and inner things would occur.

original: shing rlung gis @199b bskyod pa dag dang / phyi dang nang gi chos rnams las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shing rlung gis @199b bskyod pa dag dang / phyi dang nang gi chos rnams las 'di lta ste /
translated: From trees stirred by the wind, and from outer and inner phenomena, the sound of this would occur:🔽“Oh!

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba de lta bu'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba de lta bu'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: the sounds of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the sounds of non-arising and non-ceasing, and the sounds of the essential nature of those phenomena,

original: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong zhes bya ba dang / chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba de lta bu'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong zhes bya ba dang / chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba de lta bu'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: the sounds of all phenomena being empty of all phenomena, and the sounds of the essential nature of those phenomena,🔽whether the Tathāgatas have arisen

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: or not,

original: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: gang stong pa de la ni mtshan ma med do //
analyzed: gang stong pa de la ni mtshan ma med do //
translated: That which is empty is signless.🔽That which is signless is wishless.

original: gang mtshan ma med pa de la ni smon pa med do zhes bya bar chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / nyin par ram /
analyzed: gang mtshan ma med pa de la ni smon pa med do zhes bya bar chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / nyin par ram /
translated: The sounds of teaching the Dharma, whether by day or night,

original: mtshan mo'am / 'greng ngam /🔽'dug gam / nyal lam /
analyzed: mtshan mo'am / 'greng ngam / 'dug gam / nyal lam /
translated: whether by day or by night, whether standing,🔽walking, sitting, or lying down,

original: 'chag kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'chag kyang rung ste /
translated: whether awake or asleep,

original: de lta bu'i chos bstan pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos bstan pa'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: he will purify the buddhafield in such a way that the sound of the Dharma will be heard there.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan🔽'das gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang bsngags pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang bsngags pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And all the blessed buddhas in the world systems of the ten directions will praise that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, who has attained supreme perfect awakening in that buddhafield.

original: sems can gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa dang / mtshan thos pa de @200a *//
analyzed: sems can gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsngags pa dang / mtshan thos pa de @200a *//
translated: And all those beings who hear the praises and the name of that Tathāgata

original: dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: dag thams cad kyang /
translated: will all

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: become destined for supreme perfect awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas des chos bstan pa de la sems can 'ga' yang 'di chos yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas des chos bstan pa de la sems can 'ga' yang 'di chos yin nam /
translated: In the Dharma teaching of that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, no sentient being will have any doubt, thinking,

original: 'di chos ma yin no snyam du the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di chos ma yin no snyam du the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘This is Dharma’ or ‘This is not Dharma.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni chos ma yin pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni chos ma yin pa gang yang med de /
translated: Because in the reality of all dharmas, there is no non-Dharma.

original: de dag thams cad ni chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of them are Dharma.

original: de la sems can gang dag mi dge ba'i rtsa bas zin cing /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag mi dge ba'i rtsa bas zin cing /
translated: Among them, those sentient beings who are seized by the roots of non-virtue,

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed la /
translated: who have not planted wholesome roots toward the Buddhas and the Buddhas’ disciples,

original: mi dge ba'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa bdag tu lta ba kun tu 'dzin pa dang / lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi bar dag kun tu 'dzin pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dag la gnas pa dang / log par 'dzin pas zin pa dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa bdag tu lta ba kun tu 'dzin pa dang / lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi bar dag kun tu 'dzin pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dag la gnas pa dang / log par 'dzin pas zin pa dang /
translated: They are under the influence of nonvirtuous friends, they hold the view of a self, they hold all views, they abide in the extremes of eternalism and nihilism, they are caught up in wrong views,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa la ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'du shes la /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa la ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'du shes la /
translated: and they perceive the completely perfect buddhas to be not completely perfect buddhas.🔽They perceive those who are not completely perfect buddhas to be completely perfect buddhas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin par 'du shes pa de dag ni chos ma yin pa la ni chos su smra /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin par 'du shes pa de dag ni chos ma yin pa la ni chos su smra /
translated: They speak of what is not the Dharma as the Dharma,🔽and they speak of the Dharma as not being the Dharma.

original: chos la ni chos ma yin par smra zhing de dag chos spong bar byed do /
analyzed: chos la ni chos ma yin par smra zhing de dag chos spong bar byed do /
translated: They abandon the Dharma,

original: de dag gis chos spangs nas lus zhig ste /
analyzed: de dag gis chos spangs nas lus zhig ste /
translated: and when their bodies disintegrate,

original: shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par @200b ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par @200b ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: after death they are born in the lower realms, the bad places, the lower existences, in the hells.
