original: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sems can de dag ngan song dang lta bar gyur pa de dag las grol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sems can de dag ngan song dang lta bar gyur pa de dag las grol bar mdzad do //
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they liberate those beings in cyclic existence from the lower realms and from the views.

original: bkrol nas kyang nges pa'i phung po la 'god par mdzad de /
analyzed: bkrol nas kyang nges pa'i phung po la 'god par mdzad de /
translated: Having liberated them, they establish them in the fixed aggregates.

original: der bkod pa de dag phyin chad ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der bkod pa de dag phyin chad ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are established there will not be reborn in the lower realms from then on.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings purify a buddhafield like that.

original: yongs su dag pa'i sems can rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i sems can rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams sam /
translated: The beings who are purified there are not subject to the worldly dharmas,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams sam /
translated: or to the transcendent dharmas,

original: zag pa dang bcas ba'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas ba'i chos rnams sam /
translated: or to the dharmas with outflows,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams sam /
translated: or to the dharmas without outflows,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: or to the compounded dharmas,🔽or to the uncompounded dharmas.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: they will not stand upon any unconditioned dharma.

original: thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of them will be destined for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: From the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa bdun pa'o ////
translated: the chapter called “The Teaching of the Pure Buddhafield,” the seventy-seventh.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa /
translated: Fascicle Fifty-Five

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti asked the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges pa zhes bgyi'am /🔽'on te ma nges @201a *//
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges pa zhes bgyi'am / 'on te ma nges @201a *//
translated: are bodhisattva great beings said to be definite,

original: pa zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: pa zhes bgyi lags /
translated: or are they said to be indefinite?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nges pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nges pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings are definite.

original: ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not indefinite.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One,🔽in which group is it definite that they are—

original: nyan thos kyi phung po'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi phung po'am / rang sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
translated: the group of śrāvakas,🔽the group of pratyekabuddhas,

original: phung po gang du nges pa lags /
analyzed: phung po gang du nges pa lags /
translated: or the group of buddhas?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos kyi phung po'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos kyi phung po'am /
translated: bodhisattva great beings are not definite in the group of śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: or the group of pratyekabuddhas.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings are definite in the group of buddhas.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nges pa lags sam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nges pa lags sam /
translated: are bodhisattva great beings definite in the first production of the thought of awakening?

original: 'on te phyir mi ldog pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te phyir mi ldog pa'am /
translated: Or are they definite in the irreversible stage?

original: 'on te srid pa tha ma pa nges pa zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: 'on te srid pa tha ma pa nges pa zhes bgyi lags /
translated: Or are they definite in their last existence?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa'ang nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa'ang nges pa yin no //
translated: bodhisattva great beings are definite in the first production of the thought of awakening.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'ang nges pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'ang nges pa yin no //
translated: and also irreversible.

original: srid pa tha ma pa'ang nges pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa'ang nges pa yin no //
translated: and also in his last existence.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges par gyur pa ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges par gyur pa ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur lags sam /
translated: will bodhisattva great beings who have become irreversible be reborn in the lower realms?”

original: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not the case.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges par gyur pa ni ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges par gyur pa ni ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have become irreversible will not be reborn in the lower realms.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽@201b brgyad pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / @201b brgyad pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
translated: Will stream enterers,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: once-returners,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: non-returners,

original: dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: arhats,

original: rang sangs rgyas ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: or pratyekabuddhas be reborn in the lower realms?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One, that is not the case.”🔽The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges par gyur pa'ang ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges par gyur pa'ang ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who has reached certainty will not be reborn in the lower realms.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /🔽sbyin pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang / sems can thams cad la byams pa dang / snying rje dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste / sbyin pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang / sems can thams cad la byams pa dang / snying rje dang /
translated: Subhūti, it is impossible that a bodhisattva great being who, from the time of setting out in the vehicle,🔽gives gifts, guards morality, cultivates patience, makes an effort at perseverance, becomes absorbed in concentration, cultivates wisdom, and meditates on love, compassion,

original: dga' ba dang / btang snyoms sgom zhing /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / btang snyoms sgom zhing /
translated: joy, and equanimity for all sentient beings,

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba'i don du gnas pa de ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba'i don du gnas pa de ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: and who lives for the sake of abandoning all nonvirtuous qualities, will be reborn in the lower realms.

original: lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur pa de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur pa de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that he will be reborn among the long-lived gods.

original: gang na dge ba'i chos rnams mi spyod pa dang; lug ltar lkug par 'gyur ba'i yul rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: gang na dge ba'i chos rnams mi spyod pa dang; lug ltar lkug par 'gyur ba'i yul rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that they will be born in places where the wholesome dharmas are not practiced, or in places where people are as mute as sheep.

original: chom rkun pa dang / kla klo dang / yul mtha' 'khob dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: chom rkun pa dang / kla klo dang / yul mtha' 'khob dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that they will be born among thieves, barbarians, or in border regions.

original: log par lta ba'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that they will be born in families with wrong views.

original: gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra med pa dang / chos kyi sgra med pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra med pa de lta bur skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med @202a *//
analyzed: gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra med pa dang / chos kyi sgra med pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra med pa de lta bur skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med @202a *//
translated: It is impossible that they will be born in places where the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha are not heard.

original: do; ;byed pa med pa'i lta ba rnams la 'dug par 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: do; ;byed pa med pa'i lta ba rnams la 'dug par 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that they will sit among those with views that are not conducive to action.

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, it is impossible that a bodhisattva great being, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs pa mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod par 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs pa mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod par 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that those who have set out with the highest motivation for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should engage in the ten unwholesome actions.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu dang ldan pa'ang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu dang ldan pa'ang 'di lta ste /
translated: if even those bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible have such wholesome roots,

original: mi mthun pa'i gnas rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur lags na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i gnas rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur lags na /
translated: they will not be born in places that are not suitable,

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis dud 'gro'i 'gro bar skyes pa'i rabs bstan na /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis dud 'gro'i 'gro bar skyes pa'i rabs bstan na /
translated: then when the Tathāgata himself taught the jātaka stories of being born in the animal realm,

original: de'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gang du mchis lags /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gang du mchis lags /
translated: where were those wholesome roots then?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Venerable Subhūti having asked that, the Lord said to him,🔽“Subhūti, those wholesome roots of bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible are not lost.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mi dge ba'i las kyis dud 'gro'i 'gro bar skye ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mi dge ba'i las kyis dud 'gro'i 'gro bar skye ba ma yin mod kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas are not reborn in the animal realm due to unwholesome actions.

original: lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus thabs la mkhas pas bsam bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don du yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus thabs la mkhas pas bsam bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don du yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Rather, through skillful means they intentionally take on any kind of body that will benefit sentient beings, for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan @202b na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan @202b na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes shing /
translated: “Subhūti, through possessing skillful means, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who are born in the animal realm

original: gang dag de bsad pa'i phyir rtul bar byed na /
analyzed: gang dag de bsad pa'i phyir rtul bar byed na /
translated: and who are pursued by those who would kill them

original: de dag bla na med pa'i bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'dul zhing 'god par byed de /
analyzed: de dag bla na med pa'i bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'dul zhing 'god par byed de /
translated: cause them to take up unsurpassed patience, and they tame and establish them.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du bdag gi lus yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du bdag gi lus yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: For the sake of those very sentient beings, they give away their own bodies.

original: sems can de dag la rnam par mtho 'tsham pa mi byed pa de lta bu'i thabs la mkhas pa dgra bcom pa dag dang / rang sangs rgyas dag la yod dam /
analyzed: sems can de dag la rnam par mtho 'tsham pa mi byed pa de lta bu'i thabs la mkhas pa dgra bcom pa dag dang / rang sangs rgyas dag la yod dam /
translated: Do the arhats and pratyekabuddhas have such skillful means as that, so that they do not torment those sentient beings?

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don dang; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don dang; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: “Subhūti, for these reasons you should know that bodhisattva great beings complete great compassion for the sake of sentient beings and for the sake of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyo bar byed kyang /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyo bar byed kyang /
translated: They are born in the animal realms,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi 'gro ba'i nyes pas mi gos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi 'gro ba'i nyes pas mi gos par rig par bya'o //
translated: but are not sullied by the faults of the animal realm.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i chos gang dag la gnas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i chos gang dag la gnas shing /
translated: what wholesome dharmas do bodhisattva great beings stand in,

original: de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par bgyid lags /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par bgyid lags /
translated: How do they take up such a body?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having been thus addressed, said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba'i dge ba'i chos de lta bu'ang gang zhig yod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba'i dge ba'i chos de lta bu'ang gang zhig yod de /
translated: “Subhūti, what is that wholesome dharmas that a bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not complete?

original: dge @203a *// ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /🔽de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dge @203a *// ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The completion of all wholesome dharmas is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba'i dge ba'i chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba'i dge ba'i chos gang yang med do //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the seat of enlightenment, there is no wholesome dharma that a bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not complete.

original: dge ba'i chos de dag yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Without completing those wholesome dharmas, they will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is not possible.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed phyin chang dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed phyin chang dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la bslab par bya ste /
translated: “Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, starting from the first production of the thought of awakening, should train in completing all wholesome dharmas.

original: de la bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob cing bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad sbong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob cing bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad sbong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Training in that, they will reach the knowledge of all aspects and eliminate all residual impression connections.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dkar po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dkar po dang ldan pa /
translated: bodhisattva great beings endowed with wholesome dharmas

original: 'phags pa zag pa ma mchis pa'i las kyis ji ltar ngan song rnams sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa zag pa ma mchis pa'i las kyis ji ltar ngan song rnams sam /
translated: Noble sir, how is it that you have not fallen into the lower realms🔽with such a great mass of negative karma?”

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dag tu skye bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dag tu skye bar 'gyur lags /
translated: “Noble sir, how can the Tathāgata, who is holy and has no outflows, be reborn in the lower realms or in the animal realm through his uncontaminated karma?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / ci de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags shing zag pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags shing zag pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: “Subhūti, is the Tathāgata not holy and without outflows?”🔽He replied,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de de lta lags so //
analyzed: de de lta lags so //
translated: that is so.

original: @203b bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: @203b bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: de de lta lags te /
analyzed: de de lta lags te /
translated: that is so.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'phags shing zag pa mi mnga' ba lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'phags shing zag pa mi mnga' ba lags so //
translated: The Tathāgata is holy and without outflows.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / ci de bzhin gshegs pa dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags su mngon par sprul pa mdzad cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci de bzhin gshegs pa dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags su mngon par sprul pa mdzad cing /
translated: “Subhūti, does the Tathāgata manifest as an animal in the animal realm,

original: der mngon par sprul nas kyang /
analyzed: der mngon par sprul nas kyang /
translated: and having manifested there,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi mdzad dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi mdzad dam /
translated: does he not perform the activities of a buddha?”🔽He replied,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽he does.”

original: mdzad lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mdzad lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / ci 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa dud 'gro'i skye gnas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa dud 'gro'i skye gnas par 'gyur ram /
translated: “Subhūti, then does the Tathāgata become an animal?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it is not so.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / ci de bzhin gshegs pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci de bzhin gshegs pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ram /
translated: “Su­bhūti, do the tathāgatas experience the suffering of the animal realms?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it is not so.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa med pa dang ldan yang bsam bzhin du de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par byed cing lus des ci rigs ci tshul du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed🔽do // rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa med pa dang ldan yang bsam bzhin du de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par byed cing lus des ci rigs ci tshul du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do // rab 'byor /
translated: “Su­bhūti, in the same manner, great bodhisattva beings, although endowed with the pure, uncontaminated qualities of the noble beings, intentionally assume such bodies, and through those bodies they ripen sentient beings in whatever way is appropriate and fitting.

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Su­bhūti, what do you think?

original: dgra bcom pas sprul pa zhig mngon par sprul na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pas sprul pa zhig mngon par sprul na /
translated: If an arhat conjures up an emanation,

original: sprul pa de dgra bcom pa'i las byed cing /
analyzed: sprul pa de dgra bcom pa'i las byed cing /
translated: would the activities of that emanation be the activities of an arhat,

original: las des gzhan dag dga' ba skye bar 'gyur snyam mam /
analyzed: las des gzhan dag dga' ba skye bar 'gyur snyam mam /
translated: and would those activities cause others to feel joy?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de de lta lags so //
analyzed: de de lta lags so //
translated: it is so.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub @204a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub @204a *//
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, a bodhisattva great being,

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa med pa dang ldan yang de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa med pa dang ldan yang de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: though endowed with the pure, noble dharmas that are uncontaminated, takes up such a body.

original: lus des sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
analyzed: lus des sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
translated: And with that body, he works for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: lus de lta bu des sdug bsngal ba'ang med la /
analyzed: lus de lta bu des sdug bsngal ba'ang med la /
translated: But with that kind of body, he does not suffer.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'ang med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'ang med do //
translated: And he does not experience painful feelings.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma'i glang po che'i gzugs sam /🔽rta'am gzugs sam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma'i glang po che'i gzugs sam / rta'am gzugs sam /
translated: When a magician conjures up the form of an elephant,🔽or the form of a horse,

original: ba lang gi gzugs dag bstan tam /
analyzed: ba lang gi gzugs dag bstan tam /
translated: or the form of an ox,

original: srog chags kyi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag bstan na /
analyzed: srog chags kyi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag bstan na /
translated: or displays the forms of various other living beings,

original: de la glang po cher 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de la glang po cher 'gyur ba'am /
translated: are any of those elephants,🔽horses,

original: rtar 'gyur ba'am /🔽ba lang du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rtar 'gyur ba'am / ba lang du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: oxen,

original: srog chags kyi rigs rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag tu 'gyur ba yod snyam mam /
analyzed: srog chags kyi rigs rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag tu 'gyur ba yod snyam mam /
translated: or other living beings real?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: it is not.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa med pa dang ldan yang bsam bzhin du de lta bu'i lus nye bar ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa med pa dang ldan yang bsam bzhin du de lta bu'i lus nye bar ston te /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, although bodhisattva great beings possess the pure, uncontaminated qualities of the noble ones, they intentionally display such bodies.

original: lus de dag gis sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
analyzed: lus de dag gis sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
translated: With those bodies, they work for the welfare of sentient beings,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de lta bu nyams su myong ba med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de lta bu nyams su myong ba med do //
translated: but they do not experience such painful feelings.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa ma mchis pa de lta bu dang ldan zhing lus gang dang @204b rang gis sems can rnams kyi don bgyid par rngo thogs pa de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa ma mchis pa de lta bu dang ldan zhing lus gang dang @204b rang gis sems can rnams kyi don bgyid par rngo thogs pa de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin
translated: bodhisattva great beings who possess such uncontaminated noble wisdom as that take on whatever kind of body is suitable for working for the welfare of sentient beings with that body.

original: par bgyid pa ni thabs la mkhas pa che ba lags so //
analyzed: par bgyid pa ni thabs la mkhas pa che ba lags so //
translated: and the great skill in means is the means by which he does it.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos gang dag la gnas na /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos gang dag la gnas na /
translated: what are the bright factors on the basis of which

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu dag bgyid kyang las de dang des gos bar mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu dag bgyid kyang las de dang des gos bar mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: the bodhisattva great being, while performing such skillful means, is not defiled by those actions and their effects?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, standing in the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa yan te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa yan te /
translated: possesses such skillful means.

original: thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pas shar dang; lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bya ma snyed dag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pas shar dang; lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bya ma snyed dag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
translated: Endowed with that skillful means, he works for the welfare of beings in world systems in the east, south, west, north, and the intermediate directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: des de la reg par 'gyur ba ci'ang med do //
analyzed: des de la reg par 'gyur ba ci'ang med do //
translated: But he is not touched by any of that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des gang reg par 'gyur ba'am /🔽gang gis reg par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des gang reg par 'gyur ba'am / gang gis reg par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because the bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend any of those dharmas that would be touched,🔽or by which one would be touched,

original: gang la reg par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la reg par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or on which one would be touched.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos gsum po de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gsum po de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
translated: Because all those three dharmas are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la reg par mi byed la; stong pa nyid ni chos gang la'ang reg par mi byed cing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la reg par mi byed la; stong pa nyid ni chos gang la'ang reg par mi byed cing /
translated: Emptiness does not touch emptiness, and emptiness does not touch any dharma at all.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And emptiness is not something that can be known.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni stong pa @205a *//🔽nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni stong pa @205a *// nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in emptiness, emptiness is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / de ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: Subhūti, that is the emptiness of nonapprehending.

original: de la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Abiding in it, the bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na la gnas kyi /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na la gnas kyi /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings stand in the perfection of wisdom alone,

original: chos gzhan dag la ma lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: chos gzhan dag la ma lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: or in other dharmas as well?”

original: rab 'byor / chos gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ma 'dus pa de yod dam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ma 'dus pa de yod dam /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, is there any dharma not included in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is empty of an intrinsic nature,

original: ji ltar chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus pa lags /
translated: how is it that all dharmas are included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das stong pa nyid la ni 'dus pa dang / ma 'dus pa'i chos gang yang ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das stong pa nyid la ni 'dus pa dang / ma 'dus pa'i chos gang yang ma mchis lags so //
translated: Lord, emptiness does not include any dharma or exclude any dharma.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“So it is, Subhūti.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pas /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid du chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med do //
translated: There is no phenomenon that is not included in emptiness.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa lags so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa lags so //
translated: all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa yin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa yin na /
translated: “Subhūti, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du 'dus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du 'dus pa ma yin nam /
translated: aren’t all phenomena included in emptiness?”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de de lta lags so //🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de de lta lags so // bka' stsal pa /
translated: that is so.”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: rab @205b 'byor; rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab @205b 'byor; rnam grangs des na /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu 'di byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas thabs la mkhas pa de lta bu 'di byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: by this approach you should know that bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom in that way are skilled in means.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: How do Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas te /
translated: while standing in the emptiness of all dharmas,

original: mngon par shes pa gang la gnas na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gang la gnas na /
translated: stand in the superknowledges,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mchi zhing /🔽'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mchi zhing / 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te /
translated: and, while standing in the superknowledges, go to as many world systems as there are sand-grains in the Ganges River in the eastern direction,

original: 'tsho zhing gzhes pa chos kyang ston pa de dag la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing chos nyan pa dang / der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par 'gyur ba'i mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa lags /
analyzed: 'tsho zhing gzhes pa chos kyang ston pa de dag la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing chos nyan pa dang / der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par 'gyur ba'i mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa lags /
translated: and, in those world systems, serve and attend upon the Buddhas, the Lords, and plant wholesome roots with them, and hear the Dharma, and do not fall into the uncompounded, and do not make assumptions about all dharmas?🔽Subhuti: How, O Lord, do Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, while standing in the emptiness of all dharmas, stand in the superknowledges, and, while standing in the superknowledges, go to as many world systems as there are sand-grains in the Ganges River in the eastern direction, and, in those world systems, serve and attend upon the Buddhas, the Lords, and plant wholesome roots with them, and hear the Dharma, and do not fall into the uncompounded, and do not make assumptions about all dharmas?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of giving, gives gifts, but does not stand in it.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
translated: see that all those world systems in the eastern direction, as many as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, are empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag @206a *//
analyzed: de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag @206a *//
translated: And those lord buddhas who dwell in those world systems

original: kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing /
analyzed: kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing /
translated: are also empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: ming dang brdar btags pa bzung ste bstan pa ma gtogs par btags pa thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ming dang brdar btags pa bzung ste bstan pa ma gtogs par btags pa thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ngo //
translated: Except for the designation and indication of names and conventional terms, all designations are also seen to be empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: gal te 'jig rten gyi khams de dag ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyi khams de dag ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin la /
translated: If those world systems were not empty of an intrinsic nature,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin zhing /
translated: and those lord buddhas were not empty of an intrinsic nature,

original: btags pa'i spyod pa de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: btags pa'i spyod pa de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin na ni /
translated: If those practices of designation were not empty of an intrinsic reality,

original: de lta na nyi tshe ba'i stong pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na nyi tshe ba'i stong pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then emptiness would be limited.

original: 'di ltar nyi tshe ba'i stong pa nyid dmigs su med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyi tshe ba'i stong pa nyid dmigs su med de /
translated: But a limited emptiness is not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva skilled in means, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: attains the perfection of superknowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa de la gnas nas lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi skye ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de la gnas nas lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi skye ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Abiding in that superknowledge, he attains the divine eye, the divine ear, the performance of miracles, the knowledge of the minds of others, the recollection of former lives, and the knowledge of birth and death.

original: mngon par shes pa med par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa med par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
translated: Without the superknowledges, the bodhisattva great being cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir 'dus pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir 'dus pas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva great beings’ awakening is included in this perfection of the superknowledges.

original: mngon @206b par shes pa de dag nyid las byang chub btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon @206b par shes pa de dag nyid las byang chub btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Awakening should be sought in just those superknowledges.

original: de 'tshol ba na lha'i mig gis bdag gis kyang dge ba'i chos thams cad mthong la /
analyzed: de 'tshol ba na lha'i mig gis bdag gis kyang dge ba'i chos thams cad mthong la /
translated: When seeking them, with the divine eye one sees all wholesome dharmas,

original: gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor bar byed kyang dge ba'i chos de dag la mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor bar byed kyang dge ba'i chos de dag la mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: and one also connects others to all wholesome dharmas, but one does not settle down on those wholesome dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
translated: It is because all those wholesome dharmas are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa nyid ni gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la /
translated: Emptiness is not attachment to anything.

original: stong pa nyid la ni ro myang bar bya ba med pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni ro myang bar bya ba med pas /
translated: Emptiness is not relishing.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa med cing ro myang bar bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa med cing ro myang bar bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no attachment to it and no relishing.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: lha'i mig mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: lha'i mig mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: manifests the divine eye.

original: lha'i mig des chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig des chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du mthong ste /
translated: With that divine eye, he sees all phenomena as emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de chos nyid de la gnas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de chos nyid de la gnas shing /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in that reality,

original: lus gang bskyed pas sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus skyed par byed de /
analyzed: lus gang bskyed pas sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus skyed par byed de /
translated: manifests a body by which he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: sems can nam sems can du btags pa'ang dmigs su med do zhes mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: sems can nam sems can du btags pa'ang dmigs su med do zhes mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: He does not apprehend sentient beings or what is designated as a sentient being.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva accomplishes the perfection of the higher knowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa de dag gis mngon par shes pas gang dag bya ba'i chos de dag byed de /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de dag gis mngon par shes pas gang dag bya ba'i chos de dag byed de / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa /
translated: With those higher knowledges, he performs the activities that are to be done with the higher knowledges.🔽The bodhisattva mahāsattva, with the divine eye that is purified, surpassing that of humans, sees the worlds in the east,

original: mi'i las shin tu 'das pas shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs @207a *//
analyzed: mi'i las shin tu 'das pas shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs @207a *//
translated: in the south, in the west, in the north,

original: mtshams rnams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtshams rnams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: in the intermediate directions, below and above,

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song zhing sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song zhing sbyin pa'am /
translated: and he goes there by his magical power and practices generosity,

original: tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims sam /
translated: or practices morality,🔽or practices patience,

original: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
translated: or practices perseverance,

original: bsam gtan nam /
analyzed: bsam gtan nam /
translated: or practices concentration,

original: shes rab bam /
analyzed: shes rab bam /
translated: or practices wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nam /
translated: or practices the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang; snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang; snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: the meditative concentrations, the liberations, the meditative stabilizations, and the absorptions,

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: or the dharmas of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: or the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams sam /
translated: or the dharmas of the bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi don byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi don byed cing /
translated: or the dharmas of the buddhas,

original: sems can de dag gi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi bya ba byed do //
translated: and they will do the work of those beings.

original: de la sems can ser sna can gang yin pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: de la sems can ser sna can gang yin pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: “To those beings who are stingy, they will teach the Dharma like this:

original: sbyin pa byin cig /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin cig /
translated: ‘Give gifts!

original: dbul ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: dbul ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Poverty is suffering.

original: dbul pos ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: dbul pos ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
translated: If a poor person is unable to do even their own work,

original: gzhan gyi don lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: what need is there to mention the work of others?

original: de'i phyir khyed cag sbyin pa byin la bdag kyang bde bar gyis shig /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed cag sbyin pa byin la bdag kyang bde bar gyis shig /
translated: Therefore, give gifts and make yourselves happy.

original: gzhan yang bde bar gyis shig /
analyzed: gzhan yang bde bar gyis shig /
translated: Make others happy as well.

original: dbul bas zil gyis non cing /
analyzed: dbul bas zil gyis non cing /
translated: Overcome by poverty,

original: nying sha nying gis zos te /
analyzed: nying sha nying gis zos te /
translated: they will eat each other’s flesh.

original: ngan song gsum po dag las mi thar bar gyur ta re zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: ngan song gsum po dag las mi thar bar gyur ta re zhes chos ston to //
translated: I exhort you to be diligent in order to be liberated from the three lower realms.

original: sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa gang yin pa de dag la ni 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa gang yin pa de dag la ni 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: “To those who are immoral, I teach the Dharma as follows:

original: kye skyes bu tshul khrims 'chal ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: kye skyes bu tshul khrims 'chal ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: ‘Alas, you who are immoral, you are suffering.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar @207b mi nus na /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar @207b mi nus na /
translated: If you are immoral, you will not be able to accomplish even your own welfare,

original: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone the welfare of others.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
translated: The ripening of immorality is the hells, the animal realms, and the world of Yama.

original: de'i phyir khyed cag ngan song gsum po dag tu lhung na /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed cag ngan song gsum po dag tu lhung na /
translated: Therefore, if you fall into the three lower realms,

original: bdag kyang 'byin par mi nus na /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'byin par mi nus na /
translated: you will not be able to save yourselves,

original: gzhan dag lta ci smos kyi /🔽de'i phyir khyed cag gis 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang ma dbye zhig /
analyzed: gzhan dag lta ci smos kyi / de'i phyir khyed cag gis 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang ma dbye zhig /
translated: let alone others.🔽Therefore, do not give an opportunity to even a single immoral thought.

original: phyis 'gyod par gyur ta re zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: phyis 'gyod par gyur ta re zhes chos ston to //
translated: I exhort you to be diligent in order to avoid regret later on.’🔽“

original: sems can gang dag phan tshun 'khrug cing /
analyzed: sems can gang dag phan tshun 'khrug cing /
translated: Sentient beings who fight with each other🔽

original: gnod sems su byed pa de dag la ni 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: gnod sems su byed pa de dag la ni 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: They teach the Dharma to those sentient beings who are fighting and harming each other, saying:

original: kye skyes bu dag khyed cag gcig la gcig 'khrug par ma byed cig /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag khyed cag gcig la gcig 'khrug par ma byed cig /
translated: ‘Oh, you men, do not fight each other!

original: sems 'khrugs par gyur pa la ni dge ba'i chos 'ga' yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems 'khrugs par gyur pa la ni dge ba'i chos 'ga' yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the mind is disturbed, no wholesome dharmas arise at all.

original: de'i phyir khyed cag phan tshun 'khrug cing gnod sems su byed na /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed cag phan tshun 'khrug cing gnod sems su byed na /
translated: Therefore, if you fight each other and harbor thoughts of harming each other,

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du lhung ba'i gnas yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du lhung ba'i gnas yin gyi /
translated: you will fall into the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: de bas na khyed cag gis khro ba dang / 'khrug pa'i sems dang / gnod sems 'ga' yang bskyed par mi bya na /
analyzed: de bas na khyed cag gis khro ba dang / 'khrug pa'i sems dang / gnod sems 'ga' yang bskyed par mi bya na /
translated: Therefore, you should not give rise to any thoughts of anger, fighting, or harming each other.

original: mi dge ba'i sems gzhan dag gi go skabs dbye ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems gzhan dag gi go skabs dbye ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes chos ston to //
translated: What need is there to mention the opportunity to give rise to other unwholesome thoughts?’

original: de bzhin du sbyar te sems can le lo can gang yin pa de dag ni brtson 'grus la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te sems can le lo can gang yin pa de dag ni brtson 'grus la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, those sentient beings who are lazy, he causes to apply themselves to perseverance.

original: sems can rnam par g-yengs pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bar byed do //🔽shes rab 'chal pa gang yin pa de @208a *//
analyzed: sems can rnam par g-yengs pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bar byed do // shes rab 'chal pa gang yin pa de @208a *//
translated: Those sentient beings who are distracted, he causes to apply themselves to meditative stabilization.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.

original: dag ni shes rab la sbyor bar byed do //🔽'dod chags spyod pa gang yin pa de dag ni mi sdug pa sgom pa la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: dag ni shes rab la sbyor bar byed do // 'dod chags spyod pa gang yin pa de dag ni mi sdug pa sgom pa la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.

original: lam ngan par zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag ni lam du 'dzud par byed de /🔽nyan thos kyi lam mam /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
analyzed: lam ngan par zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag ni lam du 'dzud par byed de / nyan thos kyi lam mam / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
translated: Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam la spyod par byed de /🔽khyed cag gang la mngon par zhen pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam la spyod par byed de / khyed cag gang la mngon par zhen pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la ni mngon par zhen par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la ni mngon par zhen par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to apply themselves to wisdom.🔽Those who are of bad wisdom, he causes to

original: stong pa nyid la ni mngon par zhen pa med do zhes de dag la de ltar chos ston te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni mngon par zhen pa med do zhes de dag la de ltar chos ston te /
translated: In emptiness there is no attachment at all.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: dwell in the superknowledges and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa rnams la mi gnas par sems can rnams la chos ston pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa rnams la mi gnas par sems can rnams la chos ston pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who do not dwell in the superknowledges are unable to teach the Dharma to sentient beings

original: lam log par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams lam du 'dzud par mi nus te /
analyzed: lam log par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams lam du 'dzud par mi nus te /
translated: or to lead sentient beings who have entered wrong paths onto the right path.

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is impossible.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / bya 'dab ma med pas ni nam mkha' la 'phur mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na / bya 'dab ma med pas ni nam mkha' la 'phur mi nus so //
translated: a bird without wings is unable to fly in the sky.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang mngon par shes pa rnams la ma brten par sems can rnams la chos ston par mi nus so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang mngon par shes pa rnams la ma brten par sems can rnams la chos ston par mi nus so //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being cannot teach the doctrine to beings without having recourse to the superknowledges.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub @208b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub @208b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: should develop the superknowledges.

original: de mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag gis sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag bde blag tu byed do //
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag gis sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag bde blag tu byed do //
translated: And he who wishes to work for the welfare of beings by means of those developed superknowledges will do so easily.

original: des lha'i mig gis 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: des lha'i mig gis 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: With the divine eye he sees world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: de dag tu sems can gang dag skyes pa de dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag tu sems can gang dag skyes pa de dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: And he sees the beings who are born in those world systems.

original: des de dag mthong nas kyang rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song nas sems can de dag gi sems sems kyis shes par byed do //
analyzed: des de dag mthong nas kyang rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song nas sems can de dag gi sems sems kyis shes par byed do //
translated: Having seen them, he goes to them by means of his supernormal power and knows the minds of those sentient beings by means of his mind.

original: shes par byas nas kyang 'di ltar sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: shes par byas nas kyang 'di ltar sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: Having known them, he teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings by means of the discourse on generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on morality,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on the four noble truths,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi gtam gyis chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi gtam gyis chos ston par byed do //
translated: up to the discourse on complete nirvāṇa.

original: des lha'i rna bas mi dang mi ma yin pa dag gi sgra'ang thos so //
analyzed: des lha'i rna bas mi dang mi ma yin pa dag gi sgra'ang thos so //
translated: By means of his divine ear, he hears the sounds of humans and non-humans.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: In the eastern direction, in as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag chos ston pa de dag kyang lha'i rna bas thos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag chos ston pa de dag kyang lha'i rna bas thos so //
translated: the Bhagavān Buddhas who are teaching the Dharma, he hears them with his divine ear.

original: thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Having heard them, he takes them up just as they are.

original: de bzhin nyid du bzung nas kyang sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du bzung nas kyang sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: Having taken them up just as they are, he teaches sentient beings the discourse on generosity,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag gi gtam gyis chos ston par byed do; ;de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag gi gtam gyis chos ston par byed do; ;de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma by means of discourses on generosity, discourses on morality, discourses on heaven, discourses on the benefits of the spiritual life, and discourses on the perils of the life of cyclic existence.

original: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa des sems can rnams kyi sems shes par byas shing /🔽de dag la 'di @209a *//🔽ltar sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa des sems can rnams kyi sems shes par byas shing / de dag la 'di @209a *// ltar sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the Dharma by means of discourses on the recollection of the Buddha, discourses on the recollection of the Dharma, discourses on the recollection of the Saṅgha, discourses on the recollection of morality, discourses on the recollection of generosity, and discourses on the recollection of the deities.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag gi gtam dag gi chos ston par byed do //🔽de bdag dang gzhan dag gi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /🔽de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa des 'di ltar sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan 'di zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa 'di snyed cig byung ngo zhes bya bar yang
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag gi gtam dag gi chos ston par byed do // de bdag dang gzhan dag gi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te / de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa des 'di ltar sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan 'di zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa 'di snyed cig byung ngo zhes bya bar yang
translated: He teaches the Dharma by means of discourses on the aggregates, discourses on the constituents, discourses on the seats of the senses, discourses on the authentic and the inauthentic, and discourses on the perfections.🔽He teaches the Dharma by means of discourses on the powers, discourses on the fearlessnesses, discourses on the unique qualities of a buddha, discourses on the aspects of awakening, and discourses on the aspects of the path.

original: rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rab tu shes so //
translated: He teaches the Dharma by means of discourses on the applications of mindfulness, discourses on the thorough relinquishments, discourses on the bases of miraculous powers, discourses on the faculties, discourses on the powers, discourses on the branches of awakening, and discourses on the branches of the path.🔽He teaches the Dharma by means of discourses on the meditative absorption of the emptiness of internal phenomena, discourses on the meditative absorption of the emptiness of external phenomena, discourses on the meditative absorption of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, discourses on the meditative absorption of emptiness, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of attributes, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of aspiration, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of conceptualization, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of attributes, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of aspiration, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of conceptualization, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of birth, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of production, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of cessation, discourses on the meditative absorption of the limit of reality, discourses on the meditative absorption of the sky, discourses on the meditative absorption of the ocean, discourses on the meditative absorption of the vajra core, discourses on the meditative absorption of the mountain, discourses on the meditative absorption of the immovable, discourses on the meditative absorption of the lion, discourses on the meditative absorption of the fearless, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of fear, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of thorns, discourses on the meditative absorption of the absence of mental afflictions, discourses on the meditative absorption

original: de na sems can gang dag sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa la mos pa de dag la 'di ltar sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: de na sems can gang dag sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa la mos pa de dag la 'di ltar sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those beings who are interested in remembering their former abodes,🔽with a discourse on generosity,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi gtam dag gis chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi gtam dag gis chos ston par byed do //
translated: or with a discourse on nirvana.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyis 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa du mar song nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyis 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa du mar song nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: “With his miraculous abilities, he goes to many world systems and serves the blessed buddhas.

original: der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las dge pa'i rtsa ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las dge pa'i rtsa ba skyed par byed do //
translated: He plants roots of virtue with those blessed buddhas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du phyir 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du phyir 'ong bar byed do //
translated: Having planted roots of virtue, he returns to that world system.

original: de zag pa zad pa shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de zag pa zad pa shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: “He has the knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants, and it is utterly pure.

original: de zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa des sems can rnams la 'di ltar sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: de zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa des sems can rnams la 'di ltar sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
