translated: With that utterly pure knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants, he teaches beings a discourse on generosity,🔽or a discourse on nirvana.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi gtam gyis chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi gtam gyis chos ston par byed do //
translated: and he teaches the Dharma with a discourse on complete nirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' @209b sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' @209b sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should thus actualize the clairvoyances.

original: de mngon par shes pa shin tu 'dris pa de dag gis lus gang dang gang 'dzin par 'dod pa'i lus de dang de yongs su 'dzin par byed kyang de la bde ba'am /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa shin tu 'dris pa de dag gis lus gang dang gang 'dzin par 'dod pa'i lus de dang de yongs su 'dzin par byed kyang de la bde ba'am /
translated: With those very familiar clairvoyances, they take up whatever body they wish to take up, and they take up that body. But they do not experience pleasure or

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: pain,🔽joy or

original: yid bde ba'am /
analyzed: yid bde ba'am /
translated: grief,

original: yid mi bde ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /🔽rjes su 'chags pa'am /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te / rjes su 'chags pa'am /
translated: and they do not experience the arising of any of those.🔽They do not confess,

original: khong khro bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khong khro bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and they do not get angry.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i skyes bu ni bya ba thams cad byed kyang /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i skyes bu ni bya ba thams cad byed kyang /
translated: A person emanated by a tathāgata does all the work,

original: de la bde ba'am sdug bsngal bas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bde ba'am sdug bsngal bas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but he is not affected by pleasure or pain.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, standing in the perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing /
analyzed: mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing /
translated: plays with the superknowledges,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston kyang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston kyang /
translated: and teaches the Dharma in accordance with the aspirations in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River in the ten directions.

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal bas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal bas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But he is not defiled by happiness or suffering.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being

original: ji ltar mngon par shes pas rnam par rtses na sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de ltar mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par shes pas rnam par rtses na sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de ltar mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: should play with the superknowledges and meditate on them in such a way that the buddhafields are purified and sentient beings are brought to maturity.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma @210a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma @210a *//
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings purify a buddhafield in order to bring about the purification of beings.

original: byas; sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: byas; sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment without purifying a buddhafield and bringing beings to maturity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Subhūti, because there is no unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who have not completed the factors of awakening.🔽When this was said, the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med pa'i phyir ro; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med pa'i phyir ro; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas' purification of a buddhafield?🔽What is bringing beings to maturity?🔽What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas' completion of the factors of awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyis na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi yan🔽lag de dag gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyis na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi yan lag de dag gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what are the bodhisattva great beings’ factors of awakening, which, when perfected, lead to the full awakening of unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, all wholesome qualities are the bodhisattva great beings’ factors of awakening.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti asked,

original: dge ba'i chos gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i chos de dag gang lags /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i chos de dag gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what are the wholesome qualities that lead to the full awakening of unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa @210b rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa @210b rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, from the time when great bodhisattva beings first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
translated: they practice the transcendent perfection of generosity,

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i chos yin no //
translated: and the non-conceptualization that occurs therein is a virtuous attribute.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa la rnam par mi rtog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa la rnam par mi rtog ce na /
translated: How is it that they do not conceptualize generosity?

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the emptiness of essential nature,

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'o zhes sbyin par rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'di la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis sbyin par bya'o zhes gsum po de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'o zhes sbyin par rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'di la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis sbyin par bya'o zhes gsum po de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: they do not conceptualize generosity, thinking, ‘This is generosity,’ and they do not conceptualize the three spheres, thinking, ‘This is for the sake of this,’ and ‘I am the one who gives.’

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol bar byed do //
translated: Through this transcendent perfection of generosity, they liberate themselves from saṃsāra and they also liberate others.

original: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin te /🔽lam des 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'khor ba las brgal to rgal lo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin te / lam des 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'khor ba las brgal to rgal lo //
translated: Subhuti, these wholesome dharmas are the path of the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva's unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: brgal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this path, the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas of the past, present, and future have crossed over, are crossing over, and will cross over the world.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang; yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang; yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: rnam @211a *// par thar ba'i sgo gsum dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams dang /
analyzed: rnam @211a *// par thar ba'i sgo gsum dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams dang /
translated: the three gateways to liberation, the fourteen emptinesses, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the dhāraṇī gateways, the meditative stabilization gateways,🔽the detailed and thorough knowledges, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and all the wholesome dharmas that are the path to enlightenment—

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag dang / dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi lam ji snyed pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag dang / dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi lam ji snyed pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: those are the ones that bodhisattva great beings should complete.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob cing /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings have completed them, they attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained it, they turn the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bdun cu rtsa brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bdun cu rtsa brgyad pa'o ////
translated: this is the seventy-eighth chapter, called “The Skill in Means for Purifying a Buddhafield.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Lord Buddha🔽said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na /
translated: if those dharmas are the bodhisattvas’ dharmas,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: then, Blessed One,

original: 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gang lags /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gang lags /
translated: what are the buddhas’ dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / khyod gang yang 'di skad du gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod gang yang 'di skad du gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na /
translated: Subhuti: If these dharmas are the Bodhisattva's dharmas,

original: 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gang lags @211b zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gang lags @211b zhes zer ba ni /
translated: then what are the dharmas of the Buddhas?

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang yin te /
translated: The Lord: These very dharmas of the Bodhisattva are also the dharmas of the Buddhas.

original: gang gi tshe chos de dag rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos de dag rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
translated: When he has fully known these dharmas in all their modes,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i tshe /
translated: and has attained the knowledge of all modes,

original: de'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong bar byed do //
translated: then he will have abandoned all the residues of the defilements.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de dag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de dag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed kyi /
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, fully knows these dharmas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ni skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ni skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One has fully awakened to all dharmas in a single moment of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni khyad par de yod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni khyad par de yod do //
translated: Subhūti, this is the difference between the bodhisattva great being and the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / zhugs pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: dper na / zhugs pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: the stream-enterer is one thing,

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa'ang gzhan mod kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa'ang gzhan mod kyi /
translated: and the one abiding in the fruit is another.

original: 'on kyang de gnyis ka'ang gang zag mchog ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de gnyis ka'ang gang zag mchog ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, neither of them is not a supreme person.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the bodhisattva great being abides on the uninterrupted path,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom @212a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa ste / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom @212a *//
translated: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One has attained the wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to all dharmas.

original: pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi khyad par ni de yin no //
analyzed: pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi khyad par ni de yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is the difference between the bodhisattva great beings and the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
translated: If all dharmas are empty of their own marks,🔽in dharmas that are empty of their own marks,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la ni 'di ni sems can dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la ni 'di ni sems can dmyal ba'o //
translated: ‘This is a hell-being,

original: 'di ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'o //
translated: this is an animal,

original: 'di ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: this is a world of Yama,

original: 'di ni lha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha'o //
translated: this is a god,

original: 'di ni mi'o //🔽'di ni rigs kyi sa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi'o //🔽'di ni rigs kyi sa'o //
translated: this is a human,🔽this is the Śuddhāvāsa,

original: 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth.

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: This is a stream enterer.

original: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: This is a once-returner.

original: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: This is a non-returner.

original: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: This is an arhat.

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: This is a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: This is a bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lags so zhes bgyi ba'i bye brag dang / tha dad du bgyi ba ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lags so zhes bgyi ba'i bye brag dang / tha dad du bgyi ba ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur lags /
translated: This is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha.’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ji ltar gang zag de dag dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyang dmigs su ma mchis la /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag de dag dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyang dmigs su ma mchis la /
translated: just as those persons cannot be apprehended, so too karma cannot be apprehended.

original: ji ltar las dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar las dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as karma cannot be apprehended,

original: rnam par smin pa'ang dmigs su ma mchis lags so //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'ang dmigs su ma mchis lags so // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: so too its ripening cannot be apprehended.”🔽Venerable Subhūti having said that, the Lord said to him,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just so.🔽

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just so, just as you have said.

original: rang gi @212b mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa'ang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rang gi @212b mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa'ang dmigs su med do //
translated: In all phenomena that are empty of their own characteristics, karma and the ripening of karma are not apprehended.

original: gang dag gis chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pa de dag ni nyes par spyod pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pa de dag ni nyes par spyod pa'am /
translated: Those who do not understand that phenomena are empty of their own characteristics will engage in misconduct,

original: legs par spyod pa'am /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: legs par spyod pa'am / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: good conduct,🔽contaminated karma,

original: zag pa med pa'i las dag mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i las dag mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: and uncontaminated karma.

original: de dag nyes par spyad pa'i las kyis ni ngan song gsum po dag tu ltung ngo //
analyzed: de dag nyes par spyad pa'i las kyis ni ngan song gsum po dag tu ltung ngo //
translated: Through the karma of misconduct, they will fall into the three lower realms.

original: legs par spyad pa'i las kyis ni lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye'o //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'i las kyis ni lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye'o //
translated: Through the karma of good conduct, they will be born among gods and humans.

original: dge ba'i las skyon med pas ni gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu skye'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i las skyon med pas ni gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu skye'o //
translated: Through the karma of good conduct without fault, they will be born in the form realm and the formless realm.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyod cing /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyod cing /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of generosity up to practicing the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: skyon med pa'i spyod pas byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skyon med pa'i spyod pas byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag skyed par byed do //
translated: gives rise to those bodhisattva qualities through faultless practice.

original: de dag bskyed nas kyang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'khor dang ldan pa la snyoms par zhugs shing /
analyzed: de dag bskyed nas kyang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'khor dang ldan pa la snyoms par zhugs shing /
translated: Having given rise to them, he enters into the vajra-like meditative stabilization endowed with the branches of awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: Having fully awakened, he works for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: don byas pa des kyang chud za bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don byas pa des kyang chud za bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And because of working for their welfare, he does not waste it.

original: chud za bar mi 'gyur bas phyin chad 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chud za bar mi 'gyur bas phyin chad 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he does not waste it, he does not take rebirth in the five destinies of cyclic existence from now on.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab @213a *//
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab @213a *//
translated: The Blessed One said this, and the venerable Rāṣṭrapāla said to the Blessed One:

original: 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said this to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba dmigs lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba dmigs lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: did the Lord, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, apprehend a five-path cyclic existence?”

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: He said, “Subhūti, that is not the case.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: ci de bzhin gshegs pas chos nag po'am /
analyzed: ci de bzhin gshegs pas chos nag po'am /
translated: did the Tathāgata apprehend dharmas that are black,

original: dkar po'am / dkar gnag gam /🔽dkar po'ang ma lags /
analyzed: dkar po'am / dkar gnag gam / dkar po'ang ma lags /
translated: white, black and white,

original: nag po'ang ma lags pa dag dmigs lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: nag po'ang ma lags pa dag dmigs lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: or neither black nor white?”

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: He said, “Subhūti, that is not the case.”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: gal te ma dmigs lags na /
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs lags na /
translated: if they are not apprehended,

original: 'o na ji ltar sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du gdags pa mdzad /
translated: then how is it that the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama are designated?”

original: ji ltar lha dang mi rnams su gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar lha dang mi rnams su gdags pa mdzad /
translated: How do they designate gods and humans?

original: ji ltar rgyun du zhugs par gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyun du zhugs par gdags pa mdzad /
translated: How do they designate stream enterers?

original: ji ltar lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su gdags pa mdzad /
translated: How do they designate once-returners, non-returners, worthy ones, and pratyekabuddhas?

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: How do they designate bodhisattvas?

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gdags par mdzad lags /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gdags par mdzad lags /
translated: How do they designate tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / ci sems can 'di dag gis chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes sam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci sems can 'di dag gis chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes sam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti, do sentient beings know that phenomena are empty of their own marks?”🔽Subhūti replied,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, they do not.”

original: @213b bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @213b bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gal te sems can 'di dag gis 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar shes na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te sems can 'di dag gis 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar shes na ni /
translated: “Subhūti, if sentient beings knew that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: and the bodhisattva great beings would not enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs par ma gyur na ni /
translated: and if they had not entered into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams kyang ngan song gsum po dag dang 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba'i bar las thar bar mi byed pa zhig na /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang ngan song gsum po dag dang 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba'i bar las thar bar mi byed pa zhig na /
translated: they would not liberate beings from the three terrible forms of life up to the five forms of life in saṃsāra.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sems can 'di dag gis chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sems can 'di dag gis chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes la /
translated: Subhūti, it is because these beings do not know that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: mi shes pas de dag ngan song gsum po dag dang / 'gro ba lnga'i bar gyi 'khor ba las mi thar te /
analyzed: mi shes pas de dag ngan song gsum po dag dang / 'gro ba lnga'i bar gyi 'khor ba las mi thar te /
translated: and because they do not know that, they are not liberated from the three terrible forms of life up to the five forms of life in saṃsāra.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhes bya bar thos nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhes bya bar thos nas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva great beings, having heard from those lord buddhas that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: sems can rnams kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug go ;chos 'di dag ni ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams mngon par zhen par gyur pa de ltar yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug go ;chos 'di dag ni ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams mngon par zhen par gyur pa de ltar yod pa ma yin na /
translated: These phenomena do not exist as they are apprehended by foolish ordinary beings.

original: sems can 'di dag ni med cing yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la rang gis btags shing dmigs nas /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni med cing yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la rang gis btags shing dmigs nas /
translated: These sentient beings, having imputed and apprehended nonexistent, unreal phenomena,

original: sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes so //
analyzed: sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes so //
translated: have the idea of a sentient being where there is no sentient being.

original: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes so //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam @214a *//
analyzed: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes so // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam @214a *//
translated: They have the idea of form where there is no form.

original: par shes pa med pa la rnam par shes par 'du shes shing /
analyzed: par shes pa med pa la rnam par shes par 'du shes shing /
translated: They have the idea of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness where there is no consciousness.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag med cing /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag med cing /
translated: They have the idea of compounded and uncompounded phenomena where there are no compounded and uncompounded phenomena.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la rnam par btags pas phyin ci log rnams kyis sems bslad par gyur pa dag lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pas /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la rnam par btags pas phyin ci log rnams kyis sems bslad par gyur pa dag lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pas /
translated: Since they are not real, the mind is corrupted by the errors of conceptualization.

original: de dag 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi thar ro //
analyzed: de dag 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi thar ro //
translated: They do not escape from the five destinies of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus par byas nas spyod cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus par byas nas spyod cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having gathered all wholesome dharmas into the perfection of wisdom, practices and practices the bodhisattva conduct.

original: de la spyod cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de la spyod cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Practicing that, he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las thar bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las thar bar byed do //
translated: Having fully awakened, he liberates sentient beings from the five destinies of cyclic existence.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar bgyid lags /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar bgyid lags /
translated: liberate beings from the five forms of life in saṃsāra?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab @214b 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab @214b 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having been asked that, said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam dag ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam dag ston to //
translated: He teaches sentient beings the four noble truths, which are suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'chad do // 'god do //
analyzed: 'chad do // 'god do //
translated: He explains, establishes, and sets them forth.

original: 'jog go / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po der ni dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs gang ji snyed pa thams cad 'dus te /
analyzed: 'jog go / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po der ni dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs gang ji snyed pa thams cad 'dus te /
translated: All the virtuous qualities that are factors of awakening are included in those four noble truths.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag gis ni dkon mchog gsum po dag kyang rnam par 'jog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag gis ni dkon mchog gsum po dag kyang rnam par 'jog par 'gyur te /
translated: Those factors of awakening also establish the three jewels.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog go /
translated: the jewel of the Buddha, the jewel of the Dharma, and the jewel of the Saṅgha.

original: dkon mchog gsum po de dag byung bas sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po de dag byung bas sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because those three jewels have appeared, sentient beings will be completely liberated from the five forms of life that revolve through saṃsāra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: ci sdug bsngal 'tshal bas sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ci sdug bsngal 'tshal bas sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Is it by knowing suffering that beings will attain complete nirvana?

original: 'on te sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags /
translated: Or is it by suffering that they will attain complete nirvana?🔽Is it by knowing the arising of suffering that they will attain complete nirvana?

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags sam /🔽'on te sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar @215a *//🔽'gyur lags / sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags sam / 'on te sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar @215a *// 'gyur lags / sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Or is it by the arising of suffering that they will attain complete nirvana?🔽Is it by knowing the cessation of suffering that they will attain complete nirvana?

original: 'on te sdug bsngal 'gog pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal 'gog pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags /
translated: Or is it by the cessation of suffering that they will attain complete nirvana?

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Is it by knowing the path that leads to the cessation of suffering that they will attain complete nirvana?

original: 'on te sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur lags /
translated: Or is it that one attains complete nirvāṇa through the path that leads to the cessation of suffering?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / sdug bsngal shes pas kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sdug bsngal shes pas kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: “Su­bhūti, one does not attain complete nirvāṇa through the knowledge of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does one attain complete nirvāṇa through suffering.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba shes pas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba shes pas kyang ma yin la /
translated: One does not attain complete nirvāṇa through the knowledge of the origin of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does one attain complete nirvāṇa through the origin of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas kyang ma yin la /
translated: One does not attain complete nirvāṇa through the knowledge of the cessation of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //🔽sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam shes pas kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no // sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam shes pas kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: nor does one attain complete nirvāṇa through the cessation of suffering.🔽One does not attain complete nirvāṇa through the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor does one attain complete nirvāṇa through the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa des yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes nga smra'i /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa des yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes nga smra'i /
translated: Subhūti, I say that one will attain nirvana through the sameness of the noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal shes pas kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pas kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: One does not attain nirvana through the knowledge of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor through suffering.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba @215b shes pas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba @215b shes pas kyang ma yin la /
translated: One does not attain nirvana through the knowledge of the origin of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor through the origin of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas kyang ma yin la /
translated: One does not attain nirvana through the knowledge of the cessation of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor through the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam shes pas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam shes pas kyang ma yin la /
translated: One does not attain nirvana through the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyis kyang ma yin no //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyis kyang ma yin no // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: nor through the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.🔽When this was said, the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi mnyam pa nyid de gang lags /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi mnyam pa nyid de gang lags /
translated: What is the sameness of the four noble truths?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gang la sdug bsngal yang med /🔽sdug bsngal shes pa'ang med pa dang / gang la kun 'byung ba'ang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la sdug bsngal yang med / sdug bsngal shes pa'ang med pa dang / gang la kun 'byung ba'ang med /
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is the absence of suffering,🔽and the absence of the knowledge of suffering;🔽it is the absence of the origin of suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba shes pa'ang med pa dang / gang la 'gog pa'ang med /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pa'ang med pa dang / gang la 'gog pa'ang med /
translated: and the absence of the knowledge of the origin of suffering;🔽it is the absence of the cessation of suffering,🔽and the absence of the knowledge of the cessation of suffering;

original: 'gog pa shes pa'ang med pa dang / gang la lam yang med /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa'ang med pa dang / gang la lam yang med /
translated: and it is the absence of the path,

original: lam shes pa'ang med pa yin no //🔽rab 'byor / yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang; chos skyon med pa nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: lam shes pa'ang med pa yin no // rab 'byor / yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang; chos skyon med pa nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: and the absence of the knowledge of the path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, the thusness, the unaltered thusness, the suchness, the incorruptible suchness, the true nature, the unaltered true nature, the true nature that is not another, the establishment of phenomena, the certification of phenomena, and the actualization of phenomena of these four noble truths, whether tathāgatas arise or not,

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid du gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid du gnas pa yin la /
translated: remain as the expanse of reality.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the dharma-element is the nature of non-forgetfulness and the nature of non-deterioration.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @216a *//
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @216a *//
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: ci nas kyang bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du bden pa rtogs par bya ba la spyod do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du bden pa rtogs par bya ba la spyod do //
translated: practices the realization of the truth for the sake of realizing the truth.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang; bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang; bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said this, the venerable Subhūti said to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽how does the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: bden pa rtogs pa'i don du spyod pa lags /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pa'i don du spyod pa lags /
translated: practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of realizing the truth?

original: ji ltar spyad na ni bden pa rtogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji ltar spyad na ni bden pa rtogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: How does practice lead to the realization of the truth?

original: rtogs nas ni ji ltar de bzhin nyid du sgrub par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: rtogs nas ni ji ltar de bzhin nyid du sgrub par 'gyur lags /
translated: Having realized, how does one accomplish suchness?

original: ji ltar bsgrubs na nyan thos kyi sar mi ltung zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrubs na nyan thos kyi sar mi ltung zhing /
translated: How is it that they do not fall to the śrāvaka level,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la /
translated: and how is it that they do not fall to the pratyekabuddha level,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa lags /
translated: and how is it that they enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Subhūti, saying,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi mtha' mi mthong ba'i chos de med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi mtha' mi mthong ba'i chos de med do //
translated: “Subhūti, there is no dharma that a bodhisattva great being does not see its limits.

original: gang gi tshe ma mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: When they do not see,

original: chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: at that time they do not apprehend any dharma at all.

original: mi dmigs pas chos thams cad stong par mthong ste /🔽gang dag bden par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas chos thams cad stong par mthong ste / gang dag bden par rtogs pa'am /
translated: Because they do not apprehend, they see all dharmas as empty.🔽They see all dharmas as empty, whether they are realized to be true

original: gang dag bden par ma rtogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang dag bden par ma rtogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang stong par mthong ngo //
translated: or whether they are not realized to be true.

original: des de ltar mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs shing /
analyzed: des de ltar mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs shing /
translated: Because they see in that way, they enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas

original: rigs kyi sa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: and they abide in the stage of the family.”

original: byang chub sems @216b dpa' de rigs kyi sa la gnas nas rtse mor ltung ba gang gis nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems @216b dpa' de rigs kyi sa la gnas nas rtse mor ltung ba gang gis nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stage of lineage, by falling from the peak, falls to the śrāvaka stage or the pratyekabuddha stage.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ba'i rtse mor ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ba'i rtse mor ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this family stage does not fall into the peak, which would cause him to fall into the śrāvaka stage or the pratyekabuddha stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rigs kyi sa de la gnas nas bsam gtan bzhi skyed par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rigs kyi sa de la gnas nas bsam gtan bzhi skyed par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this family stage generates the four meditations.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi skyed par byed do //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi skyed par byed do //
translated: He generates the four immeasurables and the four formless absorptions.

original: de zhi gnas kyi sa de la gnas shing chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: de zhi gnas kyi sa de la gnas shing chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: Abiding in this stage of serenity, he discerns all phenomena.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'ang rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'ang rtogs par byed de /
translated: He also realizes the four noble truths.

original: de sdug bsngal yongs su shes kyang sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal yongs su shes kyang sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: Although he fully understands suffering, he does not generate a mind that focuses on suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba spong bar byed kyang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba spong bar byed kyang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: Although he abandons the origin, he does not generate a mind that focuses on the origin.

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du byed kyang 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du byed kyang 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He does not generate a thought that focuses on the cessation that is manifested.

original: lam sgom par byed kyang lam la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed de /
analyzed: lam sgom par byed kyang lam la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed de /
translated: He cultivates the path, but he does not generate a thought that focuses on the path.

original: gzhan du na byang chub la gzhol ba'i sems kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du na byang chub la gzhol ba'i sems kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar byed do //
translated: Otherwise, with a thought that is directed toward awakening, he sees all phenomena just as they are.

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Lord,

original: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bgyi ba gang lags /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bgyi ba gang lags /
translated: what is the suchness of all phenomena?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
translated: it is the seeing of all phenomena as emptiness.”🔽Śāriputra then asked, “Lord,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba lags /
translated: how are all phenomena seen as emptiness?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mthong ba ste /🔽des de @217a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mthong ba ste /🔽des de @217a *//
translated: it is the seeing of all phenomena as empty of their own marks.

original: lta bu'i lhag mthong des chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par lta'ang ngo bo nyid gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: lta bu'i lhag mthong des chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par lta'ang ngo bo nyid gang la gnas nas /
translated: and the insight of all dharmas are empty,

original: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid gang yang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid gang yang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: but he does not see any essence whatsoever on the basis of which he might fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, Blessed One,

original: de lta lags na dngos po ma mchis pa ni byang chub lags par 'gyur lags so //🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de lta lags na dngos po ma mchis pa ni byang chub lags par 'gyur lags so // bka' stsal pa /
translated: if that is so, then non-entity is awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: it is so, it is so.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa ni byang chub ste /
translated: Subhūti, awakening is non-entity.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyis ma mdzad /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyis ma mdzad /
translated: It is not created by the Buddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
translated: not created by the Pratyekabuddhas,

original: dgra bcom pas ma byas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pas ma byas /
translated: not created by the Arhats,

original: gang dag byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma byas te /
translated: and not created by those bodhisattva great beings who practice this awakening.

original: gzhan du na sems can rnams kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can rnams kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes /
translated: Otherwise, sentient beings would not know and see things as they really are.

original: mi mthong bas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed do //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: mi mthong bas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed do // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom teaches the Dharma to sentient beings through skillful means.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i le'u ste bdun cu rtsa dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i le'u ste bdun cu rtsa dgu pa'o ////
translated: This was the seventy-ninth chapter, “Teaching the Nature of Non-entityness,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags te /🔽de dag sangs rgyas kyis kyang @217b ma mdzad /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags te / de dag sangs rgyas kyis kyang @217b ma mdzad /
translated: if all phenomena are by nature non-existent,🔽they are not created by the Buddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not created by the solitary buddhas,

original: dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: nor by the arhats, nor by the non-returners, nor by the once-returners, nor by the stream-enterers.

original: gang dag byang chub 'di'i slad du spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma bgyis pa lags na /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub 'di'i slad du spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma bgyis pa lags na /
translated: If it is not done by those bodhisattva great beings who practice for the sake of this enlightenment,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ci'i slad du chos 'di dag la 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i slad du chos 'di dag la 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa'o //
translated: then why are these phenomena called ‘those of the hells,’

original: 'di dag ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'o //
translated: ‘those of the animal realm,’

original: 'di dag ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: ‘those of the world of Yama,’

original: 'di dag ni lha'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni lha'o //
translated: ‘those of the gods,’

original: 'di dag ni mi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi'o //
translated: ‘those of the humans,’

original: las 'dis ni sems can dmyal ba rnams su mchi'o //
analyzed: las 'dis ni sems can dmyal ba rnams su mchi'o //
translated: ‘by this karma one goes to the hells,’

original: 'dis ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su'o //
translated: ‘by this one to the animal realm,’

original: 'dis ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams su'o //
translated: ‘by this one to the world of Yama,’

original: 'dis ni lha rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni lha rnams su'o //
translated: ‘by this one to the gods,’

original: 'dis ni mi rnams su'o //🔽'dis ni tshangs ris rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi rnams su'o // 'dis ni tshangs ris rnams su'o //
translated: ‘by this one to the humans,’🔽‘by this one to the Brahmakāyika gods,’

original: 'dis ni 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'du shes med /
translated: ‘by this one to the non-percipient gods,’

original: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi lha rnams su mchi'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi lha rnams su mchi'o //
translated: or up to the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: las 'dis ni rgyun du zhugs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: las 'dis ni rgyun du zhugs pa rnams su'o //
translated: By this karma, they become stream-enterers.

original: las 'dis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag tu'o //
analyzed: las 'dis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag tu'o //
translated: By this karma, they become up to pratyekabuddhas.

original: las 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams su'o //
analyzed: las 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams su'o //
translated: By this karma, they become bodhisattvas.

original: las 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams su 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bar tha dad du dbye ba'am /🔽rnam par dgod pa dag mchis par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: las 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams su 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bar tha dad du dbye ba'am / rnam par dgod pa dag mchis par 'gyur lags /
translated: By this karma, they become tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas.’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa la ni bgyi ba gang gis sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa la ni bgyi ba gang gis sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /
translated: in the absence of things, by what karma would they go to the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /🔽gshin rje'i 'jig @218a *//
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam / gshin rje'i 'jig @218a *//
translated: or to the animal realms,

original: rten nam / mi'am /🔽lha'am / 'du shes med /
analyzed: rten nam / mi'am / lha'am / 'du shes med /
translated: or to the world of Yama, or as humans,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu mchi bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu mchi bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or as gods, or up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur pa'am /
translated: or attain the fruit of stream-entry,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of being tied to one more rebirth,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /🔽rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: arhatship,🔽the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'thob pa'am /
translated: the state of a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub kyi lam la spyod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la spyod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: the path to enlightenment,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de thob nas kyang sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar par 'gyur bar bgyi ba de lta bu gang yang ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de thob nas kyang sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar par 'gyur bar bgyi ba de lta bu gang yang ma mchis lags so //
translated: and after attaining that, the complete liberation of all sentient beings from saṃsāra.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / de de bzhin te / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord then said to the venerable Su­bhūti, “Su­bhūti!🔽It is exactly as you have said!

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!🔽Su­bhūti!

original: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa la ni las kyang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa la ni las kyang med /
translated: In the absence of things, there is no karma,

original: bya ba'ang med /
analyzed: bya ba'ang med /
translated: there is no action,

original: 'bras bu'ang med na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang med na /
translated: and there is no result.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa /
translated: “Childish ordinary beings, who are not learned,

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi shes te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi shes te /
translated: and who are unskilled in the teachings of the noble ones, do not understand that phenomena are by nature devoid of an essence.

original: de dag phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba'i sems kyis las rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pas /
analyzed: de dag phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba'i sems kyis las rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pas /
translated: They are motivated by mistaken thoughts and create various kinds of karma.

original: de dag gis lus 'di lta bu dag mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de dag gis lus 'di lta bu dag mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: Because of that, they will actualize such bodies as these:

original: sems can dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'am /
translated: the bodies of hell beings,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /🔽gshin rje'i @218b 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam / gshin rje'i @218b 'jig rten nam /
translated: the bodies of animals,🔽the bodies of anguished spirits,🔽the bodies of gods,

original: lha'am / mi'am /🔽'du shes med /
analyzed: lha'am / mi'am / 'du shes med /
translated: the bodies of humans,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi lus dag mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi lus dag mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: and the bodies of beings in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: dngos po med pa la ni las kyang med /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni las kyang med /
translated: “In the absence of an entity, there is no karma,

original: bya ba'ang med /
analyzed: bya ba'ang med /
translated: no action,

original: 'bras bu'ang med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang med de /
translated: and no result.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid do //
translated: That which is devoid of an entity is itself devoid of an entity.

original: rab 'byor / khyod gang yang 'di skad du dngos po ma mchis pa la ni bgyi ba gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i bar dag 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod gang yang 'di skad du dngos po ma mchis pa la ni bgyi ba gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i bar dag 'thob par 'gyur ba'am / dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: Subhūti, you have said, “In a non-entity, there is no such activity by which one could attain the result of stream enterer,🔽or the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub kyi bar dag 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rang byang chub kyi bar dag 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or a bodhisattva great being could practice the knowledge of path aspects,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha could attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de thob nas kyang sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba'i bgyi ba de lta bu gang yang ma mchis lags so zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de thob nas kyang sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba'i bgyi ba de lta bu gang yang ma mchis lags so zhes zer ba ni /
translated: or, having attained it, liberate beings from saṃsāra.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: lam dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lam dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is the path not a non-entity?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /🔽lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang dngos po med pa ma yin nam / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: “Is the fruit of entering the stream also not a non-entity?🔽Is the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth also not a non-entity?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth also not a non-entity?

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is arhatship also not a non-entity?

original: rang byang chub kyang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang byang chub kyang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is a pratyekabuddha’s awakening also not a non-entity?

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa ma yin nam /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @219a *//
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa ma yin nam / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @219a *//
translated: Is the knowledge of path aspects also not a non-entity?

original: pa nyid kyi bar yang dngos po med pa ma yin snyam mam /
analyzed: pa nyid kyi bar yang dngos po med pa ma yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the knowledge of all aspects also not a non-entity?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Lord,

original: lam ni dngos po ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: lam ni dngos po ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: the path is a non-entity.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags so //
