translated: The knowledge of all aspects is also a non-entity.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'o na ci dngos po med pa'i chos kyis dngos po med pa'i chos thob par 'gyur snyam mam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'o na ci dngos po med pa'i chos kyis dngos po med pa'i chos thob par 'gyur snyam mam /
translated: “Well then, Subhūti, do you think that a non-entity dharma will attain a non-entity dharma?”🔽“No it will not, Lord.”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: no, it does not.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na dngos po med pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na dngos po med pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ni ldan pa'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: therefore, the two things, namely, the non-entity and the path, are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
translated: They are formless, cannot be indicated,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and are unimpeded.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: They are of one mark, which is to say, they are without mark.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can phyin ci log bzhis phung po dag la mngon par zhen cing /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can phyin ci log bzhis phung po dag la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: with skillful means should think, 'I will liberate sentient beings who are attached to the aggregates due to the four errors,

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes shing /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes shing /
translated: who perceive the impermanent as permanent, who perceive suffering as happiness, who perceive the selfless as having a self, and who perceive the unattractive as attractive.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa dag dngos po las rnam par 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa dag dngos po las rnam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: They are liberated from things by means of things.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci byis pa so so'i @219b skye bo rnams gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: ci byis pa so so'i @219b skye bo rnams gang la gnas nas /
translated: are there any things that foolish ordinary beings, having stood in,

original: dngos po'o zhes mngon par zhen par gyur ba'i dngos po byung ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po'o zhes mngon par zhen par gyur ba'i dngos po byung ba'am /
translated: would settle down on things as ‘things that have arisen’ or ‘things that are arising,’🔽or are there any such things as ‘suchness’ or ‘unmistaken suchness’?

original: 'byung ba de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bgyi ba de lta bu mchis lags sam; gal te ma mchis na ni las gang gis 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las kyang ji ltar mngon par 'du bgyid par 'gyur lags🔽/ bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'byung ba de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bgyi ba de lta bu mchis lags sam; gal te ma mchis na ni las gang gis 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las kyang ji ltar mngon par 'du bgyid par 'gyur lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: If there are not, then how could they perform the kind of action that would liberate them from the five forms of life in saṃsāra?”

original: rab 'byor / phyin ci log ma gtogs par gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyin ci log ma gtogs par gang la gnas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, apart from error,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams las mngon par 'du byed pa'i dngos po ni tha na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas bzhag pa tsam yang med do //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams las mngon par 'du byed pa'i dngos po ni tha na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas bzhag pa tsam yang med do //
translated: There is not even a single thing that is a product of the childish ordinary beings, not even as much as the tip of a hair.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir ci nas kyang don 'di nyid rgya cher yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / mkhas pas shes par bya ba'i phyir khyod la dpes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir ci nas kyang don 'di nyid rgya cher yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / mkhas pas shes par bya ba'i phyir khyod la dpes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, therefore, I will teach you through an analogy so that this meaning can be completely fulfilled and so that the wise can understand.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rmi lam rmi ba gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba gang la gnas nas /
translated: Is there any basis for the one who is dreaming

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dag gis dga' mgur spyod par 'gyur na /🔽rmi lam rmi ba'i dngos po de lta bu 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dag gis dga' mgur spyod par 'gyur na / rmi lam rmi ba'i dngos po de lta bu 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: to enjoy himself with the five sense pleasures?🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rmi lam nyid kyang ma mchis lags na /🔽rmi lam rmi ba gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: rmi lam nyid kyang ma mchis lags na / rmi lam rmi ba gang la gnas nas /
translated: since even the dream itself does not exist,🔽how could there be any basis for the one who is dreaming

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dag gis dga' mgur spyod par 'gyur ba'i dngos po lta ga la mchis lags /
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dag gis dga' mgur spyod par 'gyur ba'i dngos po lta ga la mchis lags /
translated: to enjoy himself with the five sense pleasures?🔽”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽gang dag rmi lam lta bu ma yin pa'i 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / gang dag rmi lam lta bu ma yin pa'i 'dus byas sam /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: 'dus ma byas sam /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Are there any conditioned or unconditioned phenomena,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: or any phenomena with or without outflows,🔽that are not like a dream?🔽”

original: gsol @220a *// pa; bcom ldan 'das /🔽gang dag rmi lam lta bu ma lags pa'i 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: gsol @220a *// pa; bcom ldan 'das / gang dag rmi lam lta bu ma lags pa'i 'dus byas sam /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'dus ma byas sam /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: there are no conditioned or unconditioned phenomena,🔽or any phenomena with or without outflows,

original: zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang ma mchis lags so //
translated: that are not like a dream.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied,🔽🔽

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rmi lam la 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rmi lam la 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba yod snyam mam /
translated: Is there any cyclic existence of the five kinds of beings in a dream?🔽”🔽“Blessed One, there is not.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied, No, Bhagavan.🔽🔽The Buddha said, Therefore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva should train in the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rmi lam la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rmi lam la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Is there any path of meditation in a dream on the basis of which one would not become afflicted?

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: “Do you think that there is any path that is cultivated that would lead to purification?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: it is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos de ni dngos po ma mchis shing /
analyzed: chos de ni dngos po ma mchis shing /
translated: that phenomenon is not a thing,

original: gdags su ma mchis pa ste; brjod pa dang / tshig dang yi ge 'bru thams cad kyis gdags par bgyi ba ma lags so ////
analyzed: gdags su ma mchis pa ste; brjod pa dang / tshig dang yi ge 'bru thams cad kyis gdags par bgyi ba ma lags so ////
translated: and it cannot be designated, and it cannot be designated by all expressions, words, and syllables.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa drug pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa drug pa /
translated: Fascicle Sixty-Six

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan snang ba gang yin pa de la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan snang ba gang yin pa de la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: Is there any karma that is accumulated in the reflection of a form that appears in the surface of a mirror, due to which one would go to the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
translated: or to the realm of animals,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
translated: or to the world of Yama,

original: lha'am mir 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa @220b 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: lha'am mir 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa @220b 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: “Do you think that there is any karma that is created that would lead to rebirth as a god or a human?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: it is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzugs brnyan de ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la slu ba ma gtogs par de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la slu ba ma gtogs par de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: except for deceiving foolish ordinary beings, that reflection itself is not a real thing.

original: de la las gang mngon par 'dus bgyis pas sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /
analyzed: de la las gang mngon par 'dus bgyis pas sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /
translated: How could there be any karma that is created that would lead to rebirth in the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
translated: in the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
translated: in the world of Yama,

original: lha'am mir mchi bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du bgyid pa lta ga la mchis lags /
analyzed: lha'am mir mchi bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du bgyid pa lta ga la mchis lags /
translated: or as a god or a human?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Do you think that there is any cultivation of the path on the basis of which one would not become afflicted

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: and would not become purified?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: “No, Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzugs brnyan de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags na /🔽de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags na / de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: since that reflection itself is a non-entity,

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa lta ga la mchis lags /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa lta ga la mchis lags /
translated: how could there be any meditation on a path in dependence on which there would be neither affliction nor purification?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: chu klung dang / sman ljongs dang / nags thibs po dang / ri khrod dang / bya skyibs dag nas brag ca byung bar gyur na /
analyzed: chu klung dang / sman ljongs dang / nags thibs po dang / ri khrod dang / bya skyibs dag nas brag ca byung bar gyur na /
translated: When an echo arises from a river, a meadow, a forest, a mountain, or a cave,🔽is there any karma that is accumulated by that echo,

original: bral ca de la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: bral ca de la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: due to which one would go to the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
translated: or to the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
translated: or to the world of Yama,

original: mi rnams sam /🔽'dod pa na spyod @221a *//
analyzed: mi rnams sam / 'dod pa na spyod @221a *//
translated: or to the human realm,

original: pa'i lha rnams sam /
analyzed: pa'i lha rnams sam /
translated: or to the gods who enjoy the pleasures of desire,

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams sam /🔽'du shes med /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams sam /🔽'du shes med /
translated: or to the gods who enjoy the pleasures of form,🔽or to the gods who are without ideation,🔽or to the gods who are without discrimination,🔽or to the gods who are without movement,🔽or to the gods who are with ideation,🔽or to the gods who are with discrimination?”

analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi lha rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: or that they would create karma that would lead them to be reborn as gods in the Sphere of Neither Perception nor Non-Perception?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: it is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: brag ca de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags na /

analyzed: de la las gang mngon par 'dus bgyis pas /

analyzed: sems can dmyal bar mchi pa'am /

analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du mchi ba'am /
translated: in the world of Yama,🔽as humans,

original: mi'am / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams sam /
analyzed: mi'am / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams sam /
translated: as gods who enjoy the pleasures of the desire realm,

analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams sam / gzugs ma mchis pa na spyod pa 'du shes med /

analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: brag ca de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Is there any path to cultivate in that echo, on the basis of which there would be no affliction and

analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: no purification?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: brag ca de nyid kyang gtan ma mchis lags na / de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: since that echo itself does not exist at all,🔽how could there be any path to cultivate in it, on the basis of which there would be no affliction and

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa lta ga la mchis lags /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa lta ga la mchis lags /
translated: no purification?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: @221b rab 'byor /
analyzed: @221b rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: smig rgyu la chu med par chur 'du shes pa dang / klung med par klung du 'du shes pa dang / grong khyer med par grong khyer du 'du shes pa dang / skyed mos tshal med par skyed mos tshal du 'du shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu med par chur 'du shes pa dang / klung med par klung du 'du shes pa dang / grong khyer med par grong khyer du 'du shes pa dang / skyed mos tshal med par skyed mos tshal du 'du shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: It is like the case of a mirage, where there is no water but the idea of water arises, or a river where there is no river but the idea of a river arises, or a city where there is no city but the idea of a city arises, or a park where there is no park but the idea of a park arises.🔽

original: 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'du shes med /
translated: In the case of a mirage, there is no water, yet one perceives it as water; there is no river, yet one perceives it as a river; there is no city, yet one perceives it as a city; and there is no park, yet one perceives it as a park.🔽Do you think that any karma is created that would lead to rebirth in the hells,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: or to the state of nondiscrimination,🔽or up to the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / mig 'khrul pa ma gtogs par smig rgyu la ni chab kyang gtan ma mchis la /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / mig 'khrul pa ma gtogs par smig rgyu la ni chab kyang gtan ma mchis la /
translated: in the case of a mirage, there is absolutely no water,

original: klung yang ma mchis /
analyzed: klung yang ma mchis /
translated: no river,

original: grong khyer yang ma mchis /🔽skyed mos tshal yang ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: grong khyer yang ma mchis /🔽skyed mos tshal yang ma mchis lags na /
translated: no city,🔽and no park, except for the distorted perception and the confused vision.

original: de la las gang mngon par 'dus bgyis pas sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /🔽'du shes med /
analyzed: de la las gang mngon par 'dus bgyis pas sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am / 'du shes med /
translated: How could there be any karma that is accumulated by which one would go to the hells,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu mchi bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du bgyid pa lta ga la mchis lags /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu mchi bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du bgyid pa lta ga la mchis lags /
translated: or to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Is there any path cultivated by one whose perception has gone wrong, in dependence on which there would be neither affliction

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa gang 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa gang 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: nor purification?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'ang gtan ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'ang gtan ma mchis lags na /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de la @222a *//🔽lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la @222a *// lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: since even perception that has gone wrong does not exist at all,🔽how could there be any path cultivated

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa lta ga la mchis lags /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa lta ga la mchis lags /
translated: in dependence on which there would be neither affliction nor purification?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma sna tshogs dag cig mngon par sprul te /🔽glang po che'i tshogs sam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma sna tshogs dag cig mngon par sprul te / glang po che'i tshogs sam /
translated: If an illusionist conjured up various illusions,🔽an army of elephants,🔽an army of horses,🔽an army of oxen,

original: rta'i tshogs sam /🔽glang gi tshogs sam; dpung bu chung gi tshogs sam /
analyzed: rta'i tshogs sam / glang gi tshogs sam; dpung bu chung gi tshogs sam /
translated: an army of infantry,

original: shing rta'i tshogs sam /
analyzed: shing rta'i tshogs sam /
translated: an army of chariots,🔽the form of a woman,

original: bud med kyi gzugs sam /🔽skyes pa'i gzugs dag cig mngon par sprul na /
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs sam / skyes pa'i gzugs dag cig mngon par sprul na /
translated: or the form of a man,🔽would any karma be created by those illusory armies, through which karma they would go to the hells,🔽or go to the animal realm,🔽or go to the world of Yama,🔽or go to the realm of the gods,

original: sgyu ma'i tshogs de dag la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /🔽'du shes med /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i tshogs de dag la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am / 'du shes med /
translated: or go to the realm of the Long-Lived,🔽or go to the realm of the Four Great Kings,🔽or go to the realm of the Thirty-Three,🔽or go to the realm of the Yāma gods,🔽or go to the realm of the Joyous,🔽or go to the realm of the Excellent,🔽or go to the realm of the Demigods,🔽or go to the realm of the Gods of the Highest Peak,🔽or go to the realm of the Gods of Abundant Merit,🔽or go to the realm of the Gods Who Delight in Creation,🔽or go to the realm of the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Brahma world,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Luminous,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: or go to the realm of the gods of the Lesser Luminous,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Great Luminous,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Cloudless,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Lesser Cloudless,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Great Cloudless,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Result of Merit,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Lesser Result of Merit,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of the Great Result of Merit,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of Vastness,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of Lesser Vastness,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / de ni ma lags te /
translated: or go to the realm of the gods of Great Vastness,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of Good Vision,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of Lesser Good Vision,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: or go to the realm of the gods of Great Good Vision,🔽or go to the realm of the gods of No Thought,

original: sgyu ma de la ni gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma de la ni gang la gnas nas /
translated: or go to the realm of the gods of Lesser

original: las mngon par 'du bgyid par 'gyur ba'i dngos po tha na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas gzhag pa tsam yang ma mchis lags na /🔽de la las gang mngon par 'dus bgyis pas sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /🔽'du shes med /
analyzed: las mngon par 'du bgyid par 'gyur ba'i dngos po tha na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas gzhag pa tsam yang ma mchis lags na / de la las gang mngon par 'dus bgyis pas sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am / 'du shes med /
translated: “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not a thing, not a non-thing, not an existent, not a nonexistent, not an attainment, not a non-attainment, not pure, not impure, not increased, not decreased, not joined, not disjoined, not produced, not stopped, not defiled, not spotless, not arisen, not non-arisen, then how can the perfection of wisdom be taught?

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu mchi bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du bgyid pa lta ga la mchis lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu mchi bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du bgyid pa lta ga la mchis lags / bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not a thing, not a non-thing, not an existent, not a nonexistent, not an attainment, not a non-attainment, not pure, not impure, not increased, not decreased, not joined, not disjoined, not produced, not stopped, not defiled, not spotless, not arisen, not non-arisen, then how can the perfection of wisdom be taught?

original: sgyu @222b ma de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /🔽rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu @222b ma de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la / rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not a thing, not a non-thing, not an existent, not a nonexistent, not an attainment, not a non-attainment, not pure, not impure, not increased, not decreased, not joined, not disjoined, not produced, not stopped, not defiled, not spotless, not arisen, not non-arisen, then how can the perfection of wisdom be taught?

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / de ni ma lags te / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not a thing, not a non-thing, not an existent, not a nonexistent, not an attainment, not a non-attainment, not pure, not impure, not increased, not decreased, not joined, not disjoined, not produced, not stopped, not defiled, not spotless, not arisen, not non-arisen, then how can the perfection of wisdom be taught?🔽“Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not a thing, not a non-thing, not an existent, not a nonexistent, not an attainment, not a non-attainment, not pure, not impure, not increased, not decreased, not joined, not disjoined, not produced, not stopped, not defiled, not spotless, not arisen, not non-arisen, then how can the perfection of wisdom be taught?

original: sgyu ma de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: sgyu ma de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not a thing, not a non-thing, not an existent, not a nonexistent, not an attainment, not a non-attainment, not pure, not impure, not increased, not decreased, not joined, not disjoined, not produced, not stopped

original: de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la lam bsgom pa gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: How could there be a meditation on a path in dependence on which one would not become afflicted,

analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa lta ga la mchis lags /

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa gzhan zhig mngon par sprul na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa gzhan zhig mngon par sprul na /

analyzed: sprul pa de la las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am / 'du shes med /
translated: would that emanation create any karma by which it would go to the hells,🔽or go to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception?

analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: sprul pa de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: since that emanation itself is a non-entity,

analyzed: de la las gang mngon par 'dus bgyis pas sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /
translated: what karma would it create by which it would go to the hells,🔽or go to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'du shes med /

analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag tu mchi bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du bgyid pa lta ga la mchis lags /
translated: sphere?

analyzed: gang dag ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa'i sems can rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /

analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur gyi /

original: yang dag par mthong ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba ni /

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /

analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang med do; ;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i le'u ste brgyad cu pa'o ////
translated: This was the eightieth chapter, “On the Absence of Defilement and Purification,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das @223b la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma mchis pa bzhin du / yang dag pa ma mthong ba la'ang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ma mchis shing /

analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma mchis te / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis shing / rnam par byang ba ma mchis la / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Because, Lord, all dharmas are nonexistent.🔽And why?🔽Because, Lord, all dharmas are nonexistent.

original: dngos po la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis shing /
analyzed: dngos po la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis shing /

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ngo bo nyid la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis shing /
translated: Blessed One,🔽in reality there is no defilement and no purification.🔽Blessed One,

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis la /
translated: in the essence of non-entity there is no defilement and no purification.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis shing /

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis lags na /
translated: and in the essence of non-entity there is no defilement and no purification,

analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par byang ba bka' stsal pa de ci lta bu lags /

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam par byang bar gsungs so //
translated: “Subhūti, I have declared the equality of all dharmas to be purification.🔽” Subhuti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid de gang lags /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid de gang lags /
translated: what is the equality of all dharmas?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhuti, it is thusness, unmistaken thusness, unaltered thusness,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos @224a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos @224a *//
translated: the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-element, the established order of dharmas, the very limit of reality, the inconceivable element.

original: nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste; chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings de bzhin du gnas pa de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste; chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings de bzhin du gnas pa de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the establishment of the dharmadhātu,🔽the establishment of the real nature,

original: chos kyi dbyings yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings yin te /
translated: the establishment of the dharma-constituent,🔽the establishment of the unthinkable element,🔽the establishment of the finality of existence,🔽the establishment of the termination of existence,🔽the establishment of nirvāṇa,🔽and the establishment of the tathāgatas’ ten powers.

original: rab 'byor / de ni rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, that is called purification.

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis brjod par zad kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, that is expressed by the conventions of the world.

original: brjod du med cing 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: brjod du med cing 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is inexpressible and free from the conventions of the world.

original: ngag dang / sgra dang / tshig gi lam thams cad kyis brjod du med pa yin no //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: ngag dang / sgra dang / tshig gi lam thams cad kyis brjod du med pa yin no // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: It is inexpressible by any verbal expressions, sounds, or phrases.”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang /
translated: If all phenomena are like an illusion, like a dream, like an echo, like an optical illusion, like a reflection, like a mirage, like a city of gandharvas,

original: sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: like a magical creation,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi chos dngos po ma mchis shing /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi chos dngos po ma mchis shing /
translated: then how can a bodhisattva great being, whose phenomena are like an illusion, up to are like a magical creation, whose things do not exist,

original: rdzas ma mchis pa dag la bdag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rdzas ma mchis pa dag la bdag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
translated: whose substances do not exist, complete the perfection of giving,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
translated: up to complete the perfection of wisdom?”

original: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @224b dang; stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @224b dang; stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
translated: Similarly, I will perfect the perfection of skillful means, the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of power, the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of supernormal knowledge.

original: bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi'o //
translated: I will enter into the four meditative concentrations.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
translated: I will perfect the four immeasurables and the four formless absorptions.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom par bgyi'o //
translated: I will cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag bsgom par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag bsgom par bgyi'o //
translated: I will cultivate up to the eightfold noble path.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
translated: the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion,

original: spobs pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams thob par bgyi'o //
analyzed: spobs pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams thob par bgyi'o //
translated: eloquence, and the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcom brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcom brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
translated: I will perfect the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag thob par bgyi'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar dag thob par bgyi'o //
translated: I will attain the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks of a great being.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag snang bas khyab par bgyid pa'i 'od tshad ma mchis pa dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag snang bas khyab par bgyid pa'i 'od tshad ma mchis pa dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyi'o //
translated: I will perfect the boundless light that pervades the worlds of the great trichiliocosm.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi /
translated: In the worlds of the ten directions,

original: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rtog pa sems kyis yongs su btsal bar bgyis nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rtog pa sems kyis yongs su btsal bar bgyis nas /
translated: Having searched with my mind for the thoughts of the minds of sentient beings,

original: dbyangs gcig gis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston par 'gyur ba'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs yongs @225a *//
analyzed: dbyangs gcig gis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston par 'gyur ba'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs yongs @225a *//
translated: I will perfect the Brahma-voice that teaches the Dharma with a single sound in accordance with their aspirations.”

original: su rdzogs par bgyi'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyid lags /
analyzed: su rdzogs par bgyi'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyid lags /
translated: “Lord, how do great bodhisattva beings, having trained in the perfection of wisdom, purify the path of the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gang khyod kyis brjod pa'i chos de dag sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis brjod pa'i chos de dag sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang /
translated: Are the dharmas that you have described like an illusion, like a dream, like an echo, like an apparition, like a reflection in the mirror, like a mirage, like a city of gandharvas,

original: sprul pa lta bu ma yin snyam mam /🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu ma yin snyam mam / de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and like a magical creation?”🔽The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos de dag sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bar dag lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos de dag sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bar dag lags na /
translated: If those dharmas are like an illusion, like a dream, up to like a magical creation,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ji ltar sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi chos rnams la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyid lags /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi chos rnams la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyid lags /
translated: then how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom practice with regard to dharmas that are like an illusion, like a dream, up to like a magical creation?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / sprul pa'i bar dag ni yang dag pa ma lags te /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / sprul pa'i bar dag ni yang dag pa ma lags te /
translated: illusions, dreams, and up to magical creations are not real.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: yang dag pa ma lags pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag la spyad pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag la spyad par yang rngo mi thogs la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma lags pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag la spyad pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag la spyad par yang rngo mi thogs la /
translated: with what is not real it is not possible to practice the perfection of giving, practice the perfection of wisdom, up to practice the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa ma lags pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa ma lags pas ni /
translated: In the same way, with what is not real

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma @225b 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyad cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma @225b 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyad cing /
translated: and up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rngo mi thogs lags so //
translated: and to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,🔽“Lord, it is so!

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: It is so, Lord!🔽Lord, it is because of what is not real that one is not able to practice the perfection of giving, and up to the perfection of wisdom.🔽It is because of what is not real that one is not able to practice the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /🔽rab 'byor yang dag pa ma yin pas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te / rab 'byor yang dag pa ma yin pas ni /
translated: It is so, Subhūti!

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyad par mi nus so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyad par mi nus so //
translated: Subhūti, it is because of what is not real that one is not able to practice the perfection of giving, and up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyad cing /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyad cing /
translated: It is because of what is not real that one is not able to practice the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya snyam mam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya snyam mam /
translated: Is the perfection of giving fully awakened into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya snyam mam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya snyam mam /
translated: Is the perfection of wisdom fully awakened into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang /
translated: Are the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the fourteen emptinesses, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs @226a *//
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs @226a *//
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the higher knowledges, the tathāgatas’ powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the distinct attributes of a buddha, and the knowledge of all aspects fully awakened into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽Subhūti replied, No, Bhagavan.

original: pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Do you think that the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Lord.🔽”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Exactly so, Subhūti!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: Exactly so!

original: rab 'byor / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of giving does not awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //
translated: Up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha do not awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad ni mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / bsams pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad ni mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / bsams pa ste /
translated: Subhuti: Because all these dharmas are made and thought out.

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / bsams pa'i chos rnams kyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / bsams pa'i chos rnams kyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For dharmas which are made and thought out cannot lead to the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor / 'on kyang chos de dag thams cad ni lam sgrub pa dang / lam skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'on kyang chos de dag thams cad ni lam sgrub pa dang / lam skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: But, Subhuti, all these dharmas are the path, they are the path's equipment.

original: 'bras bu 'thob par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'thob par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not the fruit of the path.

original: chos de dag gi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid med pa'ang de yin te /
analyzed: chos de dag gi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid med pa'ang de yin te /
translated: The nonproduction and nonstopping of these dharmas is their non­ existence.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Therefore the Bodhisattva, the great being, from the first thought of enlightenment on,

original: dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'i @226b pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'i @226b pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: with wholesome dharmas, whether pertaining to the Disciples,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag gam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag gam /
translated: or to the Pratyekabuddhas, or to the knowledge of all modes,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag gam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag gam /
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: dge ba'i chos gang dang gang rtsom yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang dang gang rtsom yang rung ste /
translated: or whatever wholesome dharmas they begin,

original: de dag thams cad sgyu ma lta bur rab tu shes so //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos de dag yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de dag thams cad sgyu ma lta bur rab tu shes so // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos de dag yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'am /
translated: they know all of them to be like an illusion.🔽“They cannot bring beings to maturity or

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus pas /
translated: attain the knowledge of all aspects without completing those dharmas, from the perfection of giving up to the perfection of wisdom, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: dge ba'i chos gang ci rtsom yang rung ste /🔽de dag thams cad rmi lam lta bur rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang ci rtsom yang rung ste / de dag thams cad rmi lam lta bur rab tu shes so //
translated: know whatever wholesome dharmas they begin🔽to be like a dream,

original: sprul pa lta bu'i bar du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i bar du rab tu shes so //
translated: up to knowing them to be like a magical creation.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rmi lam lta bur rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rmi lam lta bur rab tu shes so //
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they know that up to the knowledge of all aspects is like a dream.

original: sprul pa lta bu'i bar du rab tu shes so //🔽sems can de dag kyang rmi lam lta bu la spyod do zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i bar du rab tu shes so // sems can de dag kyang rmi lam lta bu la spyod do zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: They know that up to the knowledge of all aspects is like an emanation.🔽They know that those beings are practicing in a dream.

original: sprul pa lta bu'i bar dag la spyod do zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i bar dag la spyod do zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
translated: They know that those beings are practicing in an emanation.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams dngos po med par 'dzin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams dngos po med par 'dzin te /
translated: grasp that dharmas that are like an illusion are not real things.

original: de ltar gzung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar gzung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed do //
translated: Grasping them like that, they attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi chos rnams dngos po @227a *//🔽med par 'dzin te /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi chos rnams dngos po @227a *// med par 'dzin te /
translated: They grasp that dharmas that are like an emanation are not real things.

original: de ltar gzung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar gzung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: Grasping them like that, they attain the knowledge of all aspects.🔽“Subhūti, if you ask how bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should grasp that dharmas that are like a magical illusion are not real things,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzung du med cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzung du med cing /
translated: The perfection of generosity is ungraspable.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar yang gzung du med la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar yang gzung du med la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is ungraspable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang gzung du med pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang gzung du med pa /
translated: Up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are ungraspable.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad gzung du med par rig par byas shing /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad gzung du med par rig par byas shing /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings should know that all phenomena are ungraspable.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug par byed do //
translated: They should enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa'i bar dag lta bur gzung du med cing dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu dang / sprul pa'i bar dag lta bur gzung du med cing dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are like a dream, up to like a magical creation. They are ungraspable and insubstantial.

original: sems can thams cad kyis chos de dag mi shes /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis chos de dag mi shes /
translated: All sentient beings do not know those phenomena.

original: ma mthong ba ma gtogs par gzung du med pa'i chos kyis gzung du med pa'i chos thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ma gtogs par gzung du med pa'i chos kyis gzung du med pa'i chos thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Except for not seeing, it is not possible for an ungraspable phenomenon to attain an ungraspable phenomenon.”

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug par byed de /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva engages in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de sems dang po bskyed pa nas gzung ste /
analyzed: de sems dang po bskyed pa nas gzung ste /
translated: From the time of first generating the mind of awakening,

original: sbyin pa gang ci sbyin yang rung /
analyzed: sbyin pa gang ci sbyin yang rung /
translated: whatever generosity he gives,

original: de thams cad sems can rnams kyi don du gtong ngo //
analyzed: de thams cad sems can rnams kyi don du gtong ngo //
translated: all of that he gives for the sake of sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims gang ci bsrung ba pa dang / bzod pa gang ci bsgom pa dang / brtson 'grus gang ci rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab gang ci bsgom yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims gang ci bsrung ba pa dang / bzod pa gang ci bsgom pa dang / brtson 'grus gang ci rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab gang ci bsgom yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever morality he guards, whatever patience he cultivates, whatever effort he makes, whatever meditative stabilization he enters, and whatever wisdom he cultivates,

original: de dag thams @227b cad sems can rnams kyi don du sgom gyi /
analyzed: de dag thams @227b cad sems can rnams kyi don du sgom gyi /
translated: all of that he cultivates for the sake of sentient beings.

original: bdag gi don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi don du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for his own sake.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don ma gtogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mi 'jug ste /🔽de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don ma gtogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mi 'jug ste / de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings do not set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening except for the sake of sentient beings.🔽When they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can gang dag sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes par gnas pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes par gnas pa dang / skye ba po dang / shed bu dang / shed las skyes dang / srog dang /
