original: gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar dag kyang med pa la mthong ba po'i 'du shes su gnas pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar dag kyang med pa la mthong ba po'i 'du shes su gnas pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: and the one who feels, the one who makes others do, the one who instigates, the one who knows, and the one who sees are nonexistent, those beings who are settled in the notion of the one who sees, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: phyin ci log dag las rnam par 'grol bar byed do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag las rnam par 'grol bar byed do //
translated: liberate them from error.

original: phyin ci log dag las rnam par bkrol nas kyang 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su 'god par byed do //🔽der bkod nas kyang kun tu 'byung ba 'di dag mi 'byung /
analyzed: phyin ci log dag las rnam par bkrol nas kyang 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su 'god par byed do // der bkod nas kyang kun tu 'byung ba 'di dag mi 'byung /
translated: Having liberated them from error, they establish them in the deathless realm.

original: mi rgyu ste /
analyzed: mi rgyu ste /
translated: Having established them there, these occurrences do not occur:

original: bdag gi 'du shes kun tu 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: bdag gi 'du shes kun tu 'byung ba'am /
translated: the occurrence of the notion of self,

original: byed pa po'i 'du shes kun tu 'byung ba'i bar dag kun tu mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: byed pa po'i 'du shes kun tu 'byung ba'i bar dag kun tu mi 'byung ste /
translated: up to the occurrence of the notion of the one who makes others do does not occur.

original: de g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / rlom sems dang / spros pa de dag thams cad btang nas /🔽spros pa med pa'i sems kyis rdzogs par byas te mang @228a *//
analyzed: de g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / rlom sems dang / spros pa de dag thams cad btang nas / spros pa med pa'i sems kyis rdzogs par byas te mang @228a *//
translated: Having given up all that movement, shaking, conceit, and conceptual elaboration,

original: du gnas so //
analyzed: du gnas so //
translated: he should complete it with a mind free from conceptual elaboration and remain in it a lot.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa des bdag kyang chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa des bdag kyang chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom with that skillful means neither becomes attached to any dharma

original: sems can thams cad kyang mngon par zhen pa med pa la rab tu 'god par byed de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang mngon par zhen pa med pa la rab tu 'god par byed de /
translated: nor does he establish all beings in non-attachment.

original: de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin gyi /
analyzed: de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin gyi /
translated: And that is a worldly convention,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: not the ultimate.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ci 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ci 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags sam /
translated: “The Tathāgata has fully awakened to a dharma. Has he fully awakened to that dharma as a worldly convention?

original: 'on te don dam par lags /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par lags /
translated: Or has he fully awakened to it as an ultimate truth?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di bstan to //
translated: “Subhūti, the Tathāgata has taught this dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha snyad btags pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha snyad btags pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to this dharma. This is a conventional expression that is used as a worldly convention.

original: de la ni chos 'dis chos 'di lta bu zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba gang yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de la ni chos 'dis chos 'di lta bu zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: In that, this dharma has fully awakened to this dharma in such a way that nothing is apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: chos 'dis chos 'di lta bu zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba de ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'dis chos 'di lta bu zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba de ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: This dharma has fully awakened to this dharma in such a way that nothing is apprehended.🔽Because there is no attainment and no clear realization through duality.”🔽“Lord, if there is no attainment and no clear realization through duality,🔽then is it through nonduality that there is attainment and clear realization?”

original: gnyis kyis ni 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Subhūti, there is no attainment and no clear realization through nonduality.🔽And why is that?🔽Subhūti, nonduality is not an entity.🔽Nonduality is not a real, existent entity.🔽Subhūti, if nonduality were an entity, then it would not be nonduality.🔽Subhūti, it is because nonduality is not an entity that it is called ‘nonduality.’🔽Subhūti, it is because nonduality is not a real, existent entity that it is called ‘nonduality.’🔽Subhūti, it is because nonduality is not an entity that there is attainment and clear realization through nonduality.”🔽“Lord, if nonduality is not an entity, then how can there be attainment and clear realization through nonduality?”🔽“Subhūti, it is because nonduality is not an entity that there is attainment and clear realization through nonduality.🔽And why is that?🔽Subhūti, if nonduality were an entity, then there would be no attainment and no clear realization through nonduality.🔽Subhūti, it is because nonduality is not an entity that there is attainment and clear realization through nonduality.”🔽“Lord, if nonduality is not an entity, then how can there be attainment and clear realization through nonduality?”🔽“Subhūti, it is because nonduality is not an entity that there is attainment and clear realization through nonduality.🔽And why is

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol @228b to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol @228b to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: gal te gnyis kyis 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur lags na /
analyzed: gal te gnyis kyis 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur lags na /
translated: “Lord, if one does not attain and realize through duality,

original: 'o na ci gnyis su ma mchis pas 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur lags sam; bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na ci gnyis su ma mchis pas 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur lags sam; bka' stsal pa /
translated: then, is it through nonduality that one attains and realizes?”

original: rab 'byor / gnyis kyis kyang mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gnyis kyis kyang mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: “Subhūti, one does not attain and realize through duality,

original: gnyis su med pas kyang mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur te /🔽gang la gnyis kyang med la /
analyzed: gnyis su med pas kyang mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur te / gang la gnyis kyang med la /
translated: nor does one attain and realize through nonduality.🔽Here, there is no duality,

original: gnyis ma yin pa'ang med pa de ni 'dir mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ma yin pa'ang med pa de ni 'dir mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: and there is also no nonduality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: And why?🔽‘This is the realization,

original: 'di ni mngon par rtogs so zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par rtogs so zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni spros pa'o //
translated: this one realizes.’ That is conceptual elaboration.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid la ni spros pa med de /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid la ni spros pa med de /
translated: In the sameness of dharmas there is no conceptual elaboration.

original: spros pa med pa ni chos mnyam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni chos mnyam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absence of conceptual elaboration is the sameness of dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra:

original: chos dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams la chos kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba gang zhig mchis lags /
analyzed: chos dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams la chos kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba gang zhig mchis lags /
translated: Lord, how can there be a sameness of dharmas where there is no real basis?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:

original: rab 'byor / gang la dngos po med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / yongs su brjod pa med pa de ni 'dir mnyam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la dngos po med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / yongs su brjod pa med pa de ni 'dir mnyam pa nyid yin te /
translated: Subhūti, here that which is without a real basis, without an intrinsic nature, and without verbal expression is the sameness.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The sameness of dharmas cannot be expressed.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid ma gtogs par yang chos gang yang dmigs su med de chos mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad las shin tu 'das pa ma yin no //🔽chos mnyam pa nyid ni byis pa'am /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid ma gtogs par yang chos gang yang dmigs su med de chos mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad las shin tu 'das pa ma yin no // chos mnyam pa nyid ni byis pa'am /
translated: Apart from the sameness of dharmas, no dharma can be apprehended, and the sameness of dharmas is not something that transcends all dharmas.

original: 'phags pa gang gi rten dang gnas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa gang gi rten dang gnas kyang ma yin no //
translated: The sameness of dharmas is not the basis or the support of any dharma, whether of a foolish ordinary person,🔽or of a noble one.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra:

original: ci chos mnyam pa nyid po de de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul @229a *//
analyzed: ci chos mnyam pa nyid po de de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul @229a *//
translated: Lord, is the sameness of dharmas the domain of the Tathāgata?

original: yang ma lags sam /
analyzed: yang ma lags sam /
translated: “Is it not so, O Blessed One?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / chos mnyam pa nyid ni 'phags pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos mnyam pa nyid ni 'phags pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin te /
translated: “Su­bhūti, the sameness of all phenomena is not the domain of all the noble beings.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams sam /
translated: It is not the domain of the stream-winners,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams sam /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams sam /
translated: the once-returners,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams sam /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams sam /
translated: the non-returners,

original: dgra bcom pa rnams sam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams sam /
translated: the arhats,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams sam /
translated: the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sam /
translated: the bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yul yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yul yang ma yin no //
translated: or the tathāgatas.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' sgyur ba ma lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' sgyur ba ma lags sam /
translated: are not the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas masters of the domain of all phenomena?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan la /
translated: “Su­bhūti, if the sameness of all phenomena were one thing,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang gzhan pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang gzhan pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: and the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas were another,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' sgyur bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' sgyur bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas who exercise mastery over the domain of all things.

original: rab 'byor / byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang /
translated: Su­bhūti, the sameness of the childish ordinary persons, the sameness of those who follow by means of faith and those who follow the doctrine, the sameness of those who have entered the stream,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same vein,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de @229b bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de @229b bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: the sameness of those who are tied to one more rebirth, of those who are no longer subject to rebirth, of arhats, of pratyekabuddhas, and of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,

original: mnyam pa nyid la ni tha dad du bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la ni tha dad du bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In sameness, there is not even the slightest thing to be differentiated.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni mnyam pa nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni mnyam pa nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: The sameness of ordinary people and the sameness of all the noble ones are one sameness.

original: mnyam pa nyid gcig pa la 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o; ;'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go zhes bya bar gnyis su med de /🔽mnyam pa nyid la ni 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gcig pa la 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o; ;'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go zhes bya bar gnyis su med de / mnyam pa nyid la ni 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: In one sameness, there is no duality, such that one could say, ‘This is an ordinary person,’ or ‘This is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha.’

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go zhes bya ba'i chos de dag thams cad dmigs su med do //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go zhes bya ba'i chos de dag thams cad dmigs su med do // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: In sameness, all those dharmas, such that one could say, ‘This is an ordinary person,’ or ‘This is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha,’ are not apprehended.🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti then asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: If the sameness of all dharmas is not apprehended,🔽then this is an ordinary person,

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: this is a stream enterer,

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go /
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go /
translated: this is a pratyekabuddha,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: this is a bodhisattva,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go zhes bgyi ba'i chos de dag thams cad dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go zhes bgyi ba'i chos de dag thams cad dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
translated: this is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha’ is not apprehended,

original: de ltar na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang pa rnams dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs @230a *//
analyzed: de ltar na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang pa rnams dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs @230a *//
translated: then how can the dharmas of ordinary persons, of those who follow faith, of those who follow the dharma, of stream enterers,

original: pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la'ang bye brag ma mchis par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la'ang bye brag ma mchis par 'gyur lags so //
translated: and the pratyekabuddhas, and the bodhisattvas, and the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones, would be without distinction.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: chos mnyam pa nyid la ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar dag la bye brag med do //
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid la ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar dag la bye brag med do //
translated: In the sameness of dharmas there is no distinction between foolish ordinary beings and tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te chos mnyam pa nyid la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar dag la bye bar ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos mnyam pa nyid la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar dag la bye bar ma mchis lags na /
translated: If the sameness of dharmas is not divided up in the case of foolish, ordinary people, of those who follow trust, and of the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na gang las dkon mchog gsum po sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'o na gang las dkon mchog gsum po sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur lags /
translated: then from what do the three jewels—the Buddha Jewel, the Dharma Jewel, and the Saṅgha Jewel—come into the world?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog kyang gzhan la /
translated: Is the Buddha Jewel one thing,

original: chos dkon mchog kyang gzhan zhig /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog kyang gzhan zhig /
translated: the Dharma Jewel another,

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang gzhan zhig yin la /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang gzhan zhig yin la /
translated: and the Saṅgha Jewel another,

original: chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan pa zhig yin snyam @230b mam /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan pa zhig yin snyam @230b mam /
translated: and is the sameness of dharmas something else?”🔽“No, Blessed One,” he replied.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti addressed him as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na /🔽sangs rgyas dkon mchog kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na / sangs rgyas dkon mchog kyang gzhan la /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, according to my understanding of the meaning of what the Lord has said,🔽the Buddha Jewel is one thing,

original: chos dkon mchog kyang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog kyang gzhan zhing /
translated: the Dharma Jewel is another,

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang gzhan la /
translated: the Saṅgha Jewel is another,

original: chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan pa ma lags kyi /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan pa ma lags kyi /
translated: and the sameness of dharmas is another.

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas dkon mchog gang lags pa dang / chos dkon mchog gang lags pa dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog gang lags pa dang / chos mnyam pa nyid gang lags pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma lags /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma lags /🔽gzugs ma mchis pa /🔽bstan du ma mchis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas dkon mchog gang lags pa dang / chos dkon mchog gang lags pa dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog gang lags pa dang / chos mnyam pa nyid gang lags pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma lags / mi ldan pa'ang ma lags / gzugs ma mchis pa / bstan du ma mchis pa /
translated: Lord, the Buddha Jewel, the Dharma Jewel, the Saṅgha Jewel, and the sameness of dharmas—all those dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined;🔽they are immaterial, unrevealed, and have no support.

original: thogs pa ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa ma mchis pa ste /
translated: They are not something that can be known.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis par mtshan nyid gcig pa lags na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis par mtshan nyid gcig pa lags na /
translated: If they are the same in having no defining characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la /
translated: then how is it that the Blessed One has made a presentation of phenomena that have no defining characteristics,

original: 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: saying, ‘This is an ordinary person,

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: this is a stream enterer,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par dgod pa mdzad pa 'di ci las byung lags /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag go zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par dgod pa mdzad pa 'di ci las byung lags /
translated: this is a worthy one, and this is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha’?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Venerable Subhūti having asked that, the Blessed One said to him,

original: rab 'byor / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byang chub mngon par @231a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byang chub mngon par @231a *//
translated: “Subhūti, if the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas had not fully awakened to awakening,

original: rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ma gyur la /🔽mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas te /
analyzed: rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ma gyur la / mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas te /
translated: had not fully awakened,

original: chos rnams rnam par dgod pa ma mdzad na /
analyzed: chos rnams rnam par dgod pa ma mdzad na /
translated: and had not made a presentation of phenomena,

original: sems can dmyal ba yod par mngon nam /🔽dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar dag dang; tshangs ris dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba yod par mngon nam / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar dag dang; tshangs ris dang / 'du shes med /
translated: Are the hells manifest?

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sbyar te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag dang /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sbyar te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag dang /
translated: Are the animal realms, the world of Yama, the gods, humans, the Cāturmahā­rājika gods, up to the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the Brahmakāyika gods, up to the Naiva­saṃjñā­nāsaṃjñāyatana gods, the four applications of mindfulness, up to the eightfold noble path, inner emptiness, and similarly, connect this with each, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yod par mngon snyam mam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yod par mngon snyam mam /
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha manifest?🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,🔽they are not.

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: “No, Blessed One.”🔽“

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na gang chos mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na gang chos mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la /
translated: “Subhūti, therefore, without wavering from the sameness of phenomena,

original: chos rnams rnam par dgod pa'ang mdzad pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams rnam par dgod pa'ang mdzad pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu'i mthu yin no //
translated: This is the power of the Tathāgata’s person.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: ci ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba de bzhin du so so'i skye bo rnams dang / @231b rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag kyang chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba lags sam /
analyzed: ci ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba de bzhin du so so'i skye bo rnams dang / @231b rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag kyang chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba lags sam /
translated: Are ordinary people, up to pratyekabuddhas, also not separated from the sameness of dharmas, and are bodhisattvas also not separated from the sameness of dharmas?

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba lags sam / bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: Are they also not separated from the sameness of dharmas?”🔽“Exactly so, Subhūti!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: Exactly so, Subhūti!

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo'o //
translated: Subhūti, all dharmas are not separated from the sameness of dharmas.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not go beyond the sameness of dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang /
translated: the dharmatā, the dharmadhātu,🔽the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, and the very limit of reality are the suchness,🔽unerring suchness,

original: chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de nyid so so'i skye bo rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de nyid so so'i skye bo rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: and unaltered suchness of ordinary beings,🔽the dharmatā, the dharmadhātu,

original: chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yin la /
analyzed: chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yin la /
translated: the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, and the very limit of reality.

original: de nyid dang pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang / brgyad pa rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de nyid dang pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams dang / brgyad pa rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang /
translated: the once-returners, the non-returners, the arhats,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid @232a *//
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid @232a *//
translated: the pratyekabuddhas, and the bodhisattvas.

original: dang; gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' yin te; de dag thams cad ni chos mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang; gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' yin te; de dag thams cad ni chos mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All those are not beyond the sameness of dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is it so?

original: de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni de nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni de nyid yin te /
translated: That suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness, the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the very limit of reality, and the inconceivable element—

original: de dag las chos mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las chos mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: apart from that, there is no other dharma that is equal to it or similar to it.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti then inquired further of him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang lags pa de nyid so so'i skye bo rnams kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid lags la /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang lags pa de nyid so so'i skye bo rnams kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid lags la /
translated: if that suchness of all dharmas is the suchness of ordinary people,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid lags na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid lags na /
translated: the stream-enterers, the once-returners, the non-returners, the arhats, the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas, and the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams @232b dang; rnam par shes pa gang lags pa de dag ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa lags te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams @232b dang; rnam par shes pa gang lags pa de dag ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa lags te /
translated: form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness have different characteristics.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan la /🔽tshor ba'i yang gzhan /🔽'du shes kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan la / tshor ba'i yang gzhan / 'du shes kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: The reality of form is one thing,🔽the reality of feeling is another,

original: 'du byed rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the reality of perception is another,🔽the reality of formation is another,

original: rnams par shes pa'i chos nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rnams par shes pa'i chos nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: and the reality of consciousness is another.

original: mig gi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: mig gi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: The reality of the eye is one thing,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: the dharmatā of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are different,

original: gzugs kyis chos nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: gzugs kyis chos nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: and the dharmatā of form is different.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /🔽sa'i khams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan / sa'i khams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: The dharmatā of sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are different,🔽and the dharmatā of the earth element is different.

original: chu'i khams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: The dharmatā of the water element is different,

original: me'i khams kyi'ang gzhan /🔽rlung gi khams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: me'i khams kyi'ang gzhan / rlung gi khams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the dharmatā of the fire element is different,🔽the dharmatā of the wind element is different,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the dharmatā of the space element is different,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: and the dharmatā of the consciousness element is different.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /🔽lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan / lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: The dharmatā of desire, anger, and ignorance is different,🔽and the dharmatā of the views is different.

original: bsam gtan rnams kyi'ang gzhan /🔽tshad med pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyi'ang gzhan / tshad med pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: The dharmatā of the concentrations is different,🔽the dharmatā of the immeasurables is different,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the dharmatā of the formless absorptions is different,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: and the dharmatā of the applications of mindfulness is different.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag gi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag gi'ang gzhan /
translated: the noble eightfold path is one thing,

original: stong pa nyid kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: emptiness is another,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i'ang gzhan /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i'ang gzhan /
translated: signlessness is another,

original: smon pa med pa'i'ang gzhan /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i'ang gzhan /
translated: wishlessness is another,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: inner emptiness is another,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag gi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag gi'ang gzhan /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is another,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the gateways to liberation are another,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa rnams @233a *//
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa rnams @233a *//
translated: the meditative stabilities are another,

original: kyi'ang gzhan / stobs rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: kyi'ang gzhan / stobs rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the powers are another,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the fearlessnesses are another,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges are another,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are another,

original: 'dus byas kyi khams kyi'ang gzhan /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams kyi'ang gzhan /
translated: the conditioned element is another,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan pa lags na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi chos nyid kyang gzhan pa lags na /
translated: and the unconditioned element is another.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid mtshan nyid gcig par ji ltar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid mtshan nyid gcig par ji ltar 'gyur lags /
translated: How could the dharmatā of phenomena that have different characteristics be a single characteristic?

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la gnas nas /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la gnas nas /
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, having stood in that,

original: chos rnams tha dad du bgyis pa lags /
analyzed: chos rnams tha dad du bgyis pa lags /
translated: make distinctions among phenomena?

original: chos rnams tha dad du ma bgyis par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang rngo mi thogs lags na /
analyzed: chos rnams tha dad du ma bgyis par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang rngo mi thogs lags na /
translated: If they do not make distinctions among phenomena, bodhisattva great beings cannot practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sa nas sar 'phar zhing /
analyzed: sa nas sar 'phar zhing /
translated: pass from ground to ground

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa lags /
translated: and enter into the bodhisattvas’ faultlessness?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'da' bar bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'da' bar bgyid pa lags /
translated: Having entered into the bodhisattvas’ faultless state, they transcend the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: shin tu 'das nas kyang mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: shin tu 'das nas kyang mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
translated: Having transcended them, they perfect the perfections of the higher knowledges.

original: @233b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa de dag gis rnam par rtse ba na /
analyzed: @233b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa de dag gis rnam par rtse ba na /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings play with those higher knowledges,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
translated: they perfect the perfection of generosity.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
translated: They perfect the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: rnam par rtse zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mchi ba lags /
analyzed: rnam par rtse zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mchi ba lags /
translated: They play and travel from buddha realm to buddha realm.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing /
translated: They serve the lord buddhas

original: de dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: de dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and plant the roots of virtue with them.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / khyod gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / khyod gang 'di skad du /
translated: And by those wholesome roots, they bring beings to maturity and purify a buddhafield.

original: gal te chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang lags pa de nyid so so'i skye bo rnams kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid lags la /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang lags pa de nyid so so'i skye bo rnams kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid lags la /
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if the suchness of all phenomena is the suchness of ordinary people,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid lags na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid lags na /
translated: and the suchness of the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas is also that suchness,

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid mtshan nyid gcig par ji ltar rigs zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid mtshan nyid gcig par ji ltar rigs zhes zer ba ni /
translated: then how could it be tenable that the suchness of phenomena with different characteristics is a single suchness?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de'ang stong pa nyid ma yin snyam @234a *//
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de'ang stong pa nyid ma yin snyam @234a *//
translated: Is the intrinsic nature of the form that is not empty?

original: mam / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar gyi chos nyid gang yin pa de'ang stong pa nyid ma yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mam / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar gyi chos nyid gang yin pa de'ang stong pa nyid ma yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the intrinsic nature of , up to and including the Tathāgata, not empty?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One,

original: stong pa nyid lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid lags so //
translated: it is empty.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'o na ci stong pa nyid la gang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'o na ci stong pa nyid la gang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
translated: “Well then, Subhūti, is there a phenomenon that is empty, in which the defining characteristics of form are different,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
translated: up to the defining characteristics of consciousness are different,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos shig dmigs su yod snyam mam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos shig dmigs su yod snyam mam /
translated: or the defining characteristics of , up to and including the Tathāgata, are different?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it is not so.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs 'dis 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la'ang so so'i skye bo med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs 'dis 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la'ang so so'i skye bo med la /
translated: “Subhūti, by this one of many explanations, it is like this: in the intrinsic nature of phenomena there are no ordinary persons,

original: so so'i skye bo las gud na'ang de med do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo las gud na'ang de med do //
translated: and apart from ordinary persons there is no intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: de la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar dag med la /
analyzed: de la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar dag med la /
translated: and the tathāgatas are not without the dharmadhātu.🔽You should know that the dharmadhātu is not other than the tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las gud na'ang de med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las gud na'ang de med par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the tathāgatas are not other than the dharmadhātu.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: ci chos nyid de 'dus bgyis lags sam /
analyzed: ci chos nyid de 'dus bgyis lags sam /
translated: is that dharmatā conditioned🔽or unconditioned?

original: 'on te 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'on te 'dus ma bgyis pa lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Is it conditioned or unconditioned?”🔽The Blessed One said,🔽“

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin la /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin te /🔽'dus byas las gud na'ang 'dus ma byas dmigs su med la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin te / 'dus byas las gud na'ang 'dus ma byas dmigs su med la /
translated: it is neither conditioned nor unconditioned.🔽The unconditioned cannot be observed apart from the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas las gud na'ang 'dus byas dmigs su med de /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas las gud na'ang 'dus byas dmigs su med de /
translated: and the conditioned cannot be observed apart from the unconditioned.

original: rab @234b 'byor /
analyzed: rab @234b 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de lta bas na 'dus byas kyi khams gang yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dus byas kyi khams gang yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ni ldan pa'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: therefore, those two phenomena—the conditioned element and the unconditioned element—are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: They are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be indicated,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and are unimpeded.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: They are the same in that they have no defining characteristics.🔽”

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis brjod par zad kyi /
translated: The Tathāgata has described them using worldly conventions,

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: but not ultimately.

original: don dam par ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni /
translated: Ultimately,

original: lus kyi 'du byed dam /
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dam /
translated: there are no bodily volitions,

original: ngag gi 'du byed dam /
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed dam /
translated: no verbal volitions,

original: yid kyi 'du byed gang yang med la /
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed gang yang med la /
translated: and no mental volitions.

original: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed las gud na'ang don dam par dmigs su med de /
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed las gud na'ang don dam par dmigs su med de /
translated: Apart from bodily volitions, verbal volitions, and mental volitions, the ultimate is not observed.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos de dag mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos de dag mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin no //
translated: The ultimate is the sameness of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa don dam pa las kyang mi g-yo la /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa don dam pa las kyang mi g-yo la /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not move from the ultimate,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba dag kyang byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba dag kyang byed do //
translated: and they also perform the activities of bodhisattvas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: From the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: don dam pa'i rnal 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ba ste brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa'o ////
analyzed: don dam pa'i rnal 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ba ste brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa'o ////
translated: This concludes “The Chapter on the Ultimate Yoga” from “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: if the sameness of all phenomena is empty by nature,

original: de'i slad du chos gang yang ci'ang mi bgyid @235a *//
analyzed: de'i slad du chos gang yang ci'ang mi bgyid @235a *//
translated: then no phenomenon whatsoever is engaged in anything.

original: na; ci'ang ma bgyid cing cung zad kyang ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: na; ci'ang ma bgyid cing cung zad kyang ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la /
translated: So, with respect to phenomena that are not engaged in anything and that do not exist in the slightest way,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: how is it that bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: don dam pa las kyang mi g-yo la /
analyzed: don dam pa las kyang mi g-yo la /
translated: do not waver from the ultimate

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa dag gis sems can rnams kyi don kyang bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa dag gis sems can rnams kyi don kyang bgyid pa lags /
translated: and yet also work for the welfare of sentient beings through generosity, kind words, meaningful actions, and being consistent in one’s actions?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor / stong pa nyid ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa ci'ang mi byed cing cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / stong pa nyid ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa ci'ang mi byed cing cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Subhūti, emptiness does not do anything, nor does it not do anything.

original: rab 'byor / gal te sems can 'di dag bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid shes par gyur na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te sems can 'di dag bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid shes par gyur na ni /
translated: Subhūti, if these sentient beings knew emptiness by themselves,

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa stong pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa stong pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la /
translated: then the Tathāgata would not move from emptiness

original: sems can rnams kyang bdag tu 'du shes pa dang bral bar mdzad cing phral nas kyang stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las thar bar mdzad pa dang / de bzhin du sems can du 'du shes pa dang / byed pa por 'du shes pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang bdag tu 'du shes pa dang bral bar mdzad cing phral nas kyang stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las thar bar mdzad pa dang / de bzhin du sems can du 'du shes pa dang / byed pa por 'du shes pa'i bar dang /
translated: and would liberate sentient beings from cyclic existence through emptiness, having freed them from the notion of a self and so on, up to the notion of an agent.

original: gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa'i bar dang / mig tu 'du shes pa dang / yid du 'du shes pa'i bar dang / sa'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'du shes pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa'i bar dang / mig tu 'du shes pa dang / yid du 'du shes pa'i bar dang / sa'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'du shes pa'i bar dang /
translated: and similarly, they are free from the perception of form, up to the perception of consciousness, and free from the perception of the eyes, up to the perception of the mental faculty, and free from the perception of the constituent element of the earth, up to the perception of the constituent element of consciousness,

original: 'dus @235b byas kyi khams su 'du shes pa dang bral bar mdzad cing phral nas kyang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings stong pa de la 'god par mdzad pa 'di /
analyzed: 'dus @235b byas kyi khams su 'du shes pa dang bral bar mdzad cing phral nas kyang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings stong pa de la 'god par mdzad pa 'di /
translated: and free from the perception of the compounded element, and having freed them, they establish them in that emptiness, the realm of the non-compounded.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog tu gyur par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog tu gyur par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then the Tathāgata would not be the highest, the best, the foremost, the most excellent, and the sublime among beings.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci zhig gis stong pa lags /
analyzed: ci zhig gis stong pa lags /
translated: what is empty?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de la 'du shes pa gang yin pa des stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la 'du shes pa gang yin pa des stong ngo //
translated: “Subhūti, it is empty of that perception.

original: rab 'byor / sprul pa zhig gis sprul pa gzhan sprul na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sprul pa zhig gis sprul pa gzhan sprul na /
translated: Subhūti, if an emanation were to emanate another emanation,

original: ci de la gang stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: ci de la gang stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod snyam mam /
translated: would there be anything there that is not emptiness?”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: “No, Blessed One, it is not.

original: sprul pa la ni /
analyzed: sprul pa la ni /
translated: “Subhūti, in regard to that magical creation,

original: gang stong pa nyid ma lags pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang ma mchis te /🔽stong pa nyid gang lags pa dang / sprul pa gang lags pa'i chos de gnyis ni ldan pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid ma lags pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang ma mchis te / stong pa nyid gang lags pa dang / sprul pa gang lags pa'i chos de gnyis ni ldan pa'ang ma lags /
translated: there is no entity whatsoever that is not emptiness.

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma lags te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma lags te /
translated: The two dharmas—that which is emptiness and that which is a magical creation—are not conjoined and are not disjoined.

original: chos de gnyis ni /
analyzed: chos de gnyis ni /
translated: Those two dharmas

original: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa lags so //
translated: are empty of emptiness.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?🔽Is there a magical creation that thinks,

original: 'di ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sprul pa'o //
translated: ‘This is a magical creation,’

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do //🔽zhes rnam par sprul pa zhig yod snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do // zhes rnam par sprul pa zhig yod snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: or ‘This is emptiness’?🔽”

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, it is not.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽'di ltar stong pa nyid la ni 'di ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / 'di ltar stong pa nyid la ni 'di ni sprul pa'o //
translated: Why is that?🔽It is because in emptiness, those two dharmas—‘This is a magical creation,’

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes bgyi ba'i chos de gnyis su ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes bgyi ba'i chos de gnyis su ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: and ‘This is emptiness’—do not exist as two.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gang sprul pa ma yin pa'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang sprul pa ma yin pa'i gzugs sam /
translated: “Subhūti, is there any form that is not a magical creation?

original: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
translated: feeling,🔽perception,🔽

original: 'du byed rnams sam /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sam /
translated: There is no feeling, no perception,

original: rnam par @236a *//
analyzed: rnam par @236a *//
translated: no volitional formations,

original: shes pa ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: shes pa ni gang yang med de /
translated: and no consciousness.

original: sprul pa gang yin pa de'ang stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa gang yin pa de'ang stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: What is emanated is also emptiness.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te 'jig rten pa'i chos de dag sprul pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa'i chos de dag sprul pa lags na /
translated: if those worldly dharmas are emanations,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos /
translated: then those supramundane dharmas,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag kyang sprul pa lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag kyang sprul pa lags sam /
translated: Are the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha also magical creations?

original: de dag gi 'bras bu gang lags pa dang / gang gis de dag gi gang zag tu mngon pa rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu gang lags pa dang / gang gis de dag gi gang zag tu mngon pa rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang /
translated: Are the fruits of those, and those persons who are stream enterers, once-returners, non-returners, worthy ones, pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gang lags pa'i chos de dag kyang sprul pa lags sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gang lags pa'i chos de dag kyang sprul pa lags sam /
translated: bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas also magical creations?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Subhūti having asked that, the Lord said to him,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni sprul pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni sprul pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, all dharmas are magical creations.

original: @236b de la la la ni /
analyzed: @236b de la la la ni /
translated: Some of them are

original: nyan thos kyi sprul pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sprul pa'o //
translated: emanations of śrāvakas.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some of them are

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'o //
translated: emanations of pratyekabuddhas.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some of them are

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'o //
translated: emanations of bodhisattvas.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some of them are

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
translated: emanations of tathāgatas.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some of them are

original: nyon mongs pa'i sprul pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sprul pa'o //
translated: emanations of afflictions.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some of them are

original: chos kyi sprul pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprul pa ste /
translated: emanations of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Subhūti, for these reasons all phenomena are like emanations.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: gang 'di spong ba zhes bgyi ba rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi chos de dag kyang sprul pa lags sam /
analyzed: gang 'di spong ba zhes bgyi ba rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi chos de dag kyang sprul pa lags sam /
translated: are the phenomena of the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship, which are called ‘abandonments,’ also emanations?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'i chos de dag kyang sprul pa lags sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'i chos de dag kyang sprul pa lags sam /
translated: Are the phenomena of the level of a pratyekabuddha, the level of a buddha, and the abandonment of all residual impression connections also emanations?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / bskyed pa'am /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: bkag pa'i chos gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: bkag pa'i chos gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: any phenomena whatsoever that are produced🔽or stopped

original: de dag thams cad ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni sprul pa'o //
translated: are all magical creations.🔽” Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang ma sprul pa'i chos de gang lags /
analyzed: gang ma sprul pa'i chos de gang lags /
translated: what phenomena are not magical creations?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa de ni /
translated: that which is not produced and does not stop

original: ma sprul pa'o //
analyzed: ma sprul pa'o //
translated: is not a magical creation.🔽” Subhūti said,

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,
